title: Supervisor update is broken 2023.04.1
body:
### Describe the issue you are experiencing

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/759600/234906107-99f67312-a03e-4857-a761-cdb32e62a910.png)
As seen in the above image, the upgrade from 2023.04.0 to 2023.04.1 is not possible. it appears that the image is missing from the registry. 

### What type of installation are you running?

Home Assistant OS

### Which operating system are you running on?

Home Assistant Operating System

### Steps to reproduce the issue

1.Trying to update to latest version
2. ERROR
3.
...

title: Zigbee USB stick gets 'Removed' after being used.
body:
### Describe the issue you are experiencing

Since the latest updates (supervisor + core), my (Conbee2) zigbee usb stick gets removed after it is going to be used by Home assistant. 

I am using a synology 920+ with HomeAssistant in a VM. The USB stick is parsed from the NAS. I can remove and add the USB stick, and I can see its being added/removed in the supervisor.

More info at the end.

### What type of installation are you running?

Home Assistant OS

### Which operating system are you running on?

Home Assistant Operating System

### Steps to reproduce the issue

1. Make sure that the (Zigbee) USB stick is listed in the Hardware overview
2. Start ZHA / deCONZ / Z2MQTT (the moment it tries to use the USB stick)
3. ERROR
...

### Anything in the Supervisor logs that might be useful for us?

```txt
#Parsed USB stick using synology VMM:
23-04-06 21:49:07 INFO (MainThread) [supervisor.hardware.monitor] Detecting HardwareAction.ADD hardware /dev/bus/usb/002/006 - None
23-04-06 21:49:07 INFO (MainThread) [supervisor.hardware.monitor] Detecting HardwareAction.ADD hardware /dev/ttyACM0 - /dev/serial/by-id/usb-dresden_elektronik_ingenieurtechnik_GmbH_ConBee_II_DE2219703-if00

#Starting a Zigbee addon/integration (ZHA/deConz/Z2MQTT)
23-04-06 20:58:01 INFO (MainThread) [supervisor.hardware.monitor] Detecting HardwareAction.REMOVE hardware /dev/ttyACM0 - /dev/serial/by-id/usb-dresden_elektronik_ingenieurtechnik_GmbH_ConBee_II_DE2219703-if00
23-04-06 20:58:01 INFO (MainThread) [supervisor.hardware.monitor] Detecting HardwareAction.REMOVE hardware /dev/bus/usb/002/002 - None

### Additional information

It seems that my Bluetooth USB stick just works fine. Only the zigbee stick doesnt.

What i have tried:
- Restart HomeAssistant
- Restart VM
- Restart NAS
- Unplugged NAS
- Downgraded Core to 2023.5.6 and 2023.5.5

- Use different USB port
- Tried ZHA/deCONZ/Z2MQTT

One thing i noticed is that with deCONZ. If i start the application and then parse the USB via the NAS, it works just fine. If i then reboot deCONZ, the issue happens again.

Someone typed that he fixed it by changing the Radio on ZHA. But since I removed ZHA i can't use this option anymore.

title: Failed to to call /os/datadisk/move - Can't move data partition to ...
body:
### Describe the issue you are experiencing

I have just recived my Home Assistant yellow. So i tried to set it up.

I have follwed the guide, created a ha account and tried to move the storage under: Settings -> System -> Storage.

I selected the NVME and got an error, which i can also find in the logfile:

```
2023-03-30 20:11:59.126 ERROR (MainThread) [homeassistant.components.hassio] Failed to to call /os/datadisk/move - Can't move data partition to WD-Blue-SN570-500GB-22411Y464211: 
```

I tried again, and then a window appears:
![Screenshot_20230331_082136](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1101544/229043707-7028122a-1edd-4796-8c12-e3f03b6fb025.png)

But after a while the window disapeer and the storage is not moved.

There is no new message in the log file.

I have waited 5 h but the storage is not moved.

When i try a third time the errror message changed to 
```
Fehler beim Verschieben der Datenträger
Another job is running
```

Another job is running

### What type of installation are you running?

Home Assistant OS

### Which operating system are you running on?

Home Assistant Operating System

### Steps to reproduce the issue

1. Setup an HA Yellow with an NVME with the guide
2. System -> Setting -> Storage ->  Move Storage


### Anything in the Supervisor logs that might be useful for us?

```txt
2023-03-30 20:11:59.126 ERROR (MainThread) [homeassistant.components.hassio] Failed to to call /os/datadisk/move - Can't move data partition to WD-Blue-SN570-500GB-22411Y464211:
```

title: Multiples error after upgrade Supervisor : ATTR_DATA_DISK: self.sys_os.datadisk.disk_used.id,
body:
### Describe the issue you are experiencing

Hello,
After updating Supervisor and restart, I receive a lot of error and can't access stor modules.
In Supervisor LOG : 
```23-03-30 00:56:02 WARNING (MainThread) [supervisor.utils.codenotary] rpc error: code = Unavailable desc = unexpected HTTP status code received from server: 502 (Bad Gateway); transport: received unexpected content-type "text/plain; charset=utf-8"
23-03-30 00:56:03 ERROR (MainThread) [aiohttp.server] Error handling request
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.10/site-packages/aiohttp/web_protocol.py", line 433, in _handle_request
    resp = await request_handler(request)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.10/site-packages/sentry_sdk/integrations/aiohttp.py", line 126, in sentry_app_handle
    reraise(*_capture_exception(hub))
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.10/site-packages/sentry_sdk/_compat.py", line 60, in reraise
    raise value
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.10/site-packages/sentry_sdk/integrations/aiohttp.py", line 116, in sentry_app_handle
    response = await old_handle(self, request)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.10/site-packages/aiohttp/web_app.py", line 504, in _handle
    resp = await handler(request)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.10/site-packages/aiohttp/web_middlewares.py", line 117, in impl
    return await handler(request)
  File "/usr/src/supervisor/supervisor/api/middleware/security.py", line 185, in block_bad_requests
    return await handler(request)
  File "/usr/src/supervisor/supervisor/api/middleware/security.py", line 201, in system_validation
    return await handler(request)
  File "/usr/src/supervisor/supervisor/api/middleware/security.py", line 268, in token_validation
    return await handler(request)
  File "/usr/src/supervisor/supervisor/api/middleware/security.py", line 280, in core_proxy
    return await handler(request)
  File "/usr/src/supervisor/supervisor/api/utils.py", line 62, in wrap_api
    answer = await method(api, *args, **kwargs)
  File "/usr/src/supervisor/supervisor/api/os.py", line 66, in info
    ATTR_DATA_DISK: self.sys_os.datadisk.disk_used.id,
AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'id'
```

And on Home Assistant : 
```2023-03-30 00:55:09.805 ERROR (MainThread) [homeassistant] Error doing job: Task exception was never retrieved
Traceback (most recent call last):

title: Supervisor's network management sets ipv6.method=link-local when host's kernel is configured to disable it.
body:
### Describe the issue you are experiencing

I have my host's kernel configured to disable ipv6 since this is available as of [NetworkManager v1.20](https://gitlab.freedesktop.org/NetworkManager/NetworkManager/-/blob/main/NEWS#L701)

From my /etc/sysctl.conf:
net.ipv6.conf.all.disable_ipv6 = 1
net.ipv6.conf.default.disable_ipv6 = 1
net.ipv6.conf.lo.disable_ipv6 = 1

At some point, when the supervisor container starts, NetworkManager modifies the ipv6.method from "disabled" to "link-local", which was required pre v.120 of NetworkManager. Would it be possible to update the [source code](https://github.com/home-assistant/supervisor/blob/3ceec044a80d40902757b5088bc1ad71ae911411/supervisor/dbus/network/setting/generate.py#LL95-L96) to keep the config ipv6.method=disabled?

### What type of installation are you running?

Home Assistant Supervised

### Which operating system are you running on?

Debian

### Steps to reproduce the issue

{UUID} is ID of interface that Supervisor is configured to use

1. Execute 'nmcli con modify {UUID} ipv6.method "disabled"'
2. Check that ipv6 is set to 'disabled', execute 'nmcli con show {UUID} | grep ipv6.method'
3. Execute 'ha su restart' to restart Supervisor
4. Check that ipv6 is set to "link-local", execute 'nmcli con show {UUID} | grep ipv6.method'

### Anything in the Supervisor logs that might be useful for us?

```txt
N/A, no error messages received.
```

title: Zigbee2MQTT issues since 2023.3
body:
### Describe the issue you are experiencing

I have some Tuya E14 RGB light bulbs. Specifically:
Zigbee RGB+CCT light (TS0505B)
by TuYa
Firmware: z.1.0

What's happening is that after installing 2023.3, dimming control has ceased to function for RGB. For colour temperature, they work fine. Its just RGB colour has ceased UNLESS it's pure white.

WIll not change if I use use assistant or Google Home.

I updated to 2023.3.4 as I saw various MQTT issues fixed, but the issue persists.

Additional info, I also removed and re-paired the bulbs to see if that would work but no success.

### What type of installation are you running?

Home Assistant OS

### Which operating system are you running on?

Home Assistant Operating System

### Steps to reproduce the issue

1. Go to home assistant device mentioned above
2. Play around with the colour controls
3.
...


### Anything in the Supervisor logs that might be useful for us?

title: Long-Lived Access Token keeps popping the same Token
body:
### Describe the issue you are experiencing

I’m trying to set up something and I’m force to type the long-lived access token into my app, the 1st I’ve got had too many “l” and “I” which made it a hell to type since it’s almost impossible to tell the capital “i” from lower case L, so I tried to generate another token.

To my surprise, no matter what I do or where I generate it (from the iOS app, or on my laptop) I keep getting the same token. And what’s even weirder, when I click “Create” I get a new token alright, but a couple of seconds later it magically turns in front of my eyes to the original horrible token, this also happens immeadiately if I generate QR code.

What could be possibly be the reason? I already clean cache and cookies.

Any ideas?

### What type of installation are you running?

Home Assistant OS

### Which operating system are you running on?

Home Assistant Operating System

### Steps to reproduce the issue

1. Create a Long-Lived Access Token
2. Save It
3. Create another Long-Lived Access Token
4.  Generate QR
...


### Anything in the Supervisor logs that might be useful for us?

```txt
N/A

title: SOLVED: HELP wanted: /ingress/validate_session return code 401
body:
### Describe the issue you are experiencing

Hello,
since 2 weeks the core log is flooded with error message, see screenshot.
From my understanding there is an authorization issue with the supervisor, managing addons.
I have NO IDEA how to get closer to the problem. I disabled all addons , removed HACS, rebooted several times…
I created new user with admin rights, I checked CPU/MEM with glances on the r4 with 4GB mem, all OK.
using safari and chrome on different macOS clients, same problem.
Trying to show the supervisor log results in timeout: 502: Bad gateway. 
What can I do?
THANK YOU for any hint!

### What type of installation are you running?

Home Assistant Supervised

### Which operating system are you running on?

Other (e.g., Raspbian/Raspberry Pi OS/Fedora)

### Steps to reproduce the issue

1. Restart
2. Login
3. wait some minutes
4. open Logs/core and supervisor
5. see messages in screenshot (above)

title: Error: Activating connection failed, check connection settings - While attempting to connect to wifi
body:
### Describe the issue you are experiencing

I´m trying to connet to my inverter Wifi to use the Huawei Solar integration but I´m unable to connect as I always get the error  that the connection failed:

Error: Activating connection failed, check connection settings

Both from UI as well as terminal - I also tried to connect manually using the following command:
```
➜  ~ ha network update wlan0 --wifi-mode infrastructure --ipv4-method auto --wifi-auth wpa-psk --wifi-ssid 'SUN2000-BT2140072791' --wifi-psk 'mypassword' --log-level debug

Home Assistant OS

title: Unhealthy system - Setup failed
body:
### Describe the issue you are experiencing

I get an error message "Unhealthy system - Setup failed".
```
System is currently unhealthy because setup failed to complete. There are a number of reasons this can occur, use the link to learn more and how to fix this.
Critical - 07/02/2023
```

following [learn more](https://www.home-assistant.io/more-info/unhealthy/setup) i can deduce that this is NOT a DBUS issue because there is no matching error.
Restart Supervisor does not help.
Reboot host does not help.
`ha supervisor repair` does not help.

Also it seems this is not an NTP issue as date sync fine.

### What type of installation are you running?

Home Assistant OS

### Which operating system are you running on?

Home Assistant Operating System

Unsure. This started appearing around Home Assistant updates to versions starting 2023 and frequent power "flicks" of the HA device (thanks russia).

But History issue is intermittent and is not reproducing currently... Setup is Unhealthy persists.

title: No content visible in Add-Ons
body:
### Describe the issue you are experiencing

Do not see any add-ons on the add-ons section of settings. 
I am running HAOS in a virtual machine (using the QCOW image).  The VM is configured with 2vCPUs and 4GB of RAM with a 50G storage device.  The VM booted correctly and brought me to the onboarding step, which I completed.  When I go to settings | Add-ons, I see "You don't have any add-ons installed yet. Head over to the add-on store to get started!".
Clicking "Add-on Store" takes me to a empty page (except for search).  

I also run HA on a Pi4, which behaves normally, and have it running in a container on kubernetes (although of course that version does not have the add-on store).  I'm pretty familiar with HA, but have not seen this before.

![Screenshot 2023-02-16 3 35 11 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12127180/219493102-e4be3b09-15df-4b52-8487-d97db8b5e8c2.png)

Home Assistant OS

filename in title\n- Added menu item to open configurator in new tab\n- Automatically load last viewed (and not closed) file via localStorage\n- CTRL+s / CMD+s can now be used to save files\n- Prompting before saving now opt-in in editor settings\n\n## 0.2.5\n\n- Added warning-logs for access failure\n- Added transparency to whitespace characters\n- Using external repository for Docker\n- Modify BANNED_IPS and ALLOWED_NETWORKS at runtime\n- Use relative paths in webserver\n- Added \"Sesame\" feature\n\n## 0.2.4\n\n- YAML lint support\n- Support new Hass.io token system\n"
        },

          "auto_update": false,
          "changelog": "# Changelog\n\n## 9.6.1\n\n- Upgrade Home Assistant CLI to 4.21.0\n\n## 9.6.0\n\n**Breaking change**: RSA keys generated using the SHA-1 hash algorithm\nwere disabled by OpenSSH due to a security vulnerability. If you find\nyour RSA key does not work after update you will need to make a new key\nwith a stronger algorithm or switch to an ECDSA or Ed25519 type key. For\nmore information see [OpenSSH v8.8 release notes](https://www.openssh.com/releasenotes.html).\n\n- Upgrade Home Assistant CLI to 4.18.0\n- Upgrade to Alpine 3.16\n- Refactor out usage of fix-attrs for s6 v3\n\n## 9.4.0\n\n- Upgrade Home Assistant CLI to 4.17.0\n- Enabled image signature\n\n## 9.3.0\n\n- Update libwebsockets to 4.2.1\n- Update ttyd to `3e37e33b1cd927ae8f25cfbcf0da268723b6d230`\n\n## 9.2.2\n\n- Fix escape codes in color bash prompt\n\n## 9.2.1\n\n- Upgrade Home Assistant CLI to 4.14.0\n\n## 9.2.0\n\n- Upgrade to Alpine 3.14\n- Make Bash prompt more colorful\n- Upgrade Home Assistant CLI to 4.13.0\n\n## 9.1.3\n\n- Upgrade Home Assistant CLI to 4.12.3\n\n## 9.1.2\n\n- Upgrade Home Assistant CLI to 4.12.2\n\n## 9.1.1\n\n- Use GitHub Container Registry for the base image\n- Upgrade Home Assistant CLI to 4.12.1\n- Upstream ttyd project now uses the main branch\n\n## 9.1.0\n\n- Upgrade Home Assistant CLI to 4.11.0\n- Support APKs installation on startup\n\n## 9.0.2\n\n- Update options schema for passwords\n\n## 9.0.1\n\n- Upgrade Home Assistant CLI to 4.10.1\n\n## 9.0.0\n\n- Upgrade Alpine Linux to 3.13\n- Update Home Assistant CLI to 4.10.0\n- Use new HA banner on login\n\n## 8.10.0\n\n- Update Home Assistant CLI to 4.9.0\n\n## 8.9.1\n\n- Fix bluez package\n\n## 8.9.0\n\n- Update Home Assistant CLI to 4.4.1\n- Add Bluetooth support\n\n## 8.8.1\n\n- Support new media folder\n\n## 8.8.0\n\n- Update Home Assistant CLI to 4.4.1\n- Wrap system shutdown/reboot to supervisor\n\n## 8.7.0\n\n- Update Home Assistant CLI to 4.4.0\n- Upgrade Alpine Linux to 3.12\n\n## 8.6.0\n\n- Add support for local TCP forwarding\n\n## 8.5.4\n\n- Update Home Assistant CLI to 4.3.0\n\n## 8.5.3\n\n- Update Home Assistant CLI to 4.2.0\n\n## 8.5.2\n\n- Update Home Assistant CLI to 4.1.0\n\n## 8.5.1\n\n- Show warning if SSH port is disabled\n\n## 8.5.0\n\n- Add support for PulseAudio with new Audio backend\n- Migrate to s6-overlay\n\n## 8.4.0\n\n- Support to use only web terminal without SSH server\n\n**ATTENTION:** If you want access with SSH, you need maybe add the Port setting option back.\n\n## 8.3.0\n\n- Update Home Assistant CLI to 4.0.1\n- Add backward compatibility with the hassio command\n- Update Web terminal to ttyd 1.6.0 with Libwebsockets 3.2.2\n- Rename HASSIO_TOKEN to SUPERVISOR_TOKEN in shell profile\n\n## 8.2.0\n\n- Fix creation of new tmux terminal windows\n- Add add-on icon\n- Update welcome logo\n- Fix SSH folder issue with authorized keys\n\n## 8.1.0\n\n- Fix for non existing .bash_profile startup error\n- Add current, short, path to command line prompt\n\n## 8.0.0\n\n- Add support for a web-based terminal via Ingress\n- Upgrade Alpine Linux to 3.11\n- Improve Hass.io API token handling\n- Persist .ssh folder across restarts\n- Add helper symlink folders to user home folder\n"
        }

title: docker image not running - gives an error

i am on arch linux and trying to run docker image (homeassistant/amd64-hassio-supervisor) but its giving me errors:

Can someone please help me out.

### What type of installation are you running?

Home Assistant OS

### Which operating system are you running on?

Home Assistant Operating System

1. docker pull homeassistant/amd64-hassio-supervisor

title: Can’t install updates or restore backups
body:
### Describe the issue you are experiencing

Since a couple of days I can’t install any add-on update or restore any backup. When I try to restore a backup it gives me this:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25168870/215581776-e98578c5-9b1f-49ec-ae6d-f9f61bbced83.png)

I suspect problems began after installing supervisor update 2023.01.1. In the logs (https://home.xxxx.xxx/hassio/system) nothing related is found. I’ve have a pendig update for ESPHome, but this can’t be installed because of the same error. I tried to reboot, did all latest apt-get updates, doesn’t make any difference. Even an “ha su repair” on the CLI gives the same error. I don’t have a warning about the system being unhealthy.

### What type of installation are you running?

Home Assistant Supervised

### Which operating system are you running on?

Home Assistant Operating System

### Steps to reproduce the issue

1. Try to restore a backup

title: Issue updating (old) version of Supervisor
body:
### Describe the issue you are experiencing

Quick notes:
Raspberry Pi 4 (8gb)
HA version: 2022.10.5 (this is after I restored an old image backup, I was on 2022.11.3 or something similar and it had the same issue when upgrading)
Current Supervisor version: 2022.10.0

I had been away for a long while now and didn’t want to update HA while away in case some automation broke due to an update and me not knowing until I got home. Unfortunately, I’m now unable to update at all (usually update as soon as a new version hits the market!). It appears Supervisor in particular is the one failing. I click to install the update for the normal HA update, and it says Supervisor needs updated in the logs - sure no problem… But when trying update Supervisor, here’s what I get when looking at the logs (`docker logs --follow hassio_supervisor`):

```

No logs are produced in the homeassistant core container

Reminder - this is an imaged (literally 1:1 image because I used `dd`) recovery of a backup I made a few months ago. That backup at the time it was made was able to update through versions without issues. There's something about the latest version of supervisor and HA that it doesn't like. I'm not sure if this is due to a network change that may have happened on my end since then, or if it's due to some downstream service being down... I don't feel like it's a configuration problem though since I know this installation was able to update several times before.

Other notes -> ghcr.io seems to be up/running and I can resolve it without issues, so I don’t think it’s that… Those 3 warnings in particular are related to an issue unrelated to this (old version reaching out to blocked `o427061.ingest.sentry.io`)

### What type of installation are you running?

Home Assistant Supervised

### Which operating system are you running on?

Other (e.g., Raspbian/Raspberry Pi OS/Fedora)

### Steps to reproduce the issue

1. Open HA after it's started up
2. Click the update for Supervisor
3. Click install
4. Nothing happens
5. SSH into system, notice Supervisor container is dead, start it up again with `docker start hassio_supervisor`

title: `supervisor_version` not stored properly in backup.json
body:
### Describe the issue you are experiencing

When I create a backup using the backups feature, the `supervisor_version` property in the backup.json file from the backup tar archive is not set correctly.

Based on this code:

https://github.com/home-assistant/supervisor/blob/c193c91fe7ad16165a91c200b746e913a0fa7b37/supervisor/backups/backup.py#L179-L185

I would expect the first few lines of backup.json to look like this:
```json
{
  "version": 2,
  "slug": "3cb7ce75",
  "name": "test",
  "date": "2022-12-26T19:37:55.998989+00:00",
  "type": "full",
  "supervisor_version": "2022.11.2",
```

But instead, this is what I see in backup.json:
```json
{
  "version": 2,
  "slug": "3cb7ce75",
  "name": "test",
  "date": "2022-12-26T19:37:55.998989+00:00",
  "type": "full",
  "2022.11.2": "2022.11.2",
```

It seems that somehow, it is using the actual supervisor version number as the key, instead of the string `"supervisor_version"`.

### What type of installation are you running?

Home Assistant OS

### Which operating system are you running on?

Home Assistant Operating System

### Steps to reproduce the issue

1. Create a backup using the backups feature.
2. Download the backup.
3. Extract the tar archive and look at the backup.json.

N/A

title: Unsupported system - Protections disabled
body:
### Describe the issue you are experiencing

Following the prescribed steps to resolve "Unsupported system - Protections disabled" does not work. This [problem was previously reported](https://github.com/home-assistant/supervisor/issues/3988), and [this commit 24 days ago supposedly fixed the problem](https://github.com/home-assistant/supervisor/pull/4007), but I'm still experiencing the issue on 2022.12.1.

### What type of installation are you running?

Home Assistant Supervised

### Which operating system are you running on?

Debian

### Steps to reproduce the issue

Several versions ago: I ``sudo ha jobs options --ignore-conditions healthy``. Seeing this suggested repair, I followed the instructions [here](https://www.home-assistant.io/more-info/unsupported/job_conditions) to re-enable the protection mechanism. No change. I've tried restarting Home Assistant as well as upgrading to the latest version (2022.12.1) of Home Assistant Supervised and repeating the re-enable process. No change.

title: Empty config/addons directory after rollback from 2022.12.0 to 2022.11.5
body:
### Describe the issue you are experiencing

Well, the title says basically all. 
Anyway: while upgrading from 2022.11.5 to 2022.12.0 I did a backup.
Due to https://github.com/home-assistant/core/issues/83555#issuecomment-1343913548_ I needed to restore this backup.
And than this:
```
➜  ~ pwd                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      
/root                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         
➜  ~ tree                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     
.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             
├── addons -> /addons                                                                                                                                                                                                                         
├── backup -> /backup                                                                                                                                                                                                                         
├── config -> /config                                                                                                                                                                                                                         
├── media -> /media                                                                                                                                                                                                                           
├── share -> /share
└── ssl -> /ssl

6 directories, 0 files
➜  ~ ls -la config/ /config/
/config/:
total 0

config/:
total 0
➜  ~ mount|fgrep config
/dev/sda8 on /config type ext4 (rw,relatime,commit=30)

➜  ~ for d in *; do echo $d $(ls $d/|head -1) ;done;
addons
backup 094f2ed0.tar
config
media
share check_config.txt
ssl fullchain.pem

```
Not only in the terminal, but of course also nothing in File Editor, ESP-Home, Addons and so on.
Beside that system seems to work normal, so can access the logs via the frontend for example or the above output is coming out of the ssh addon.
As shown, other mounts on same partition are not empty.
I'm just guessing here that this is supervisor related.

### What type of installation are you running?

Home Assistant OS

### Which operating system are you running on?

Other (e.g., Raspbian/Raspberry Pi OS/Fedora)

### Steps to reproduce the issue

1. upgrade to 2022.12.0 from 2022.11.5 inclusive backup
2. restore backup
3. watch the emptiness 
...


### Anything in the Supervisor logs that might be useful for us?

```txt
Unfortunately nothing related in the logs - not in supervisor nor in host.
```


### System Health information

Not so helpful I think (because it shows the restored state) but anyway:

title: Docker image validation
body:
### Describe the issue you are experiencing

The regex used to validate the Docker image option in add-on configs is too strict. It causes the Supervisor to reject local add-ons which have the following `image:` specified in `config.yaml`:
- `my.registry.tld/test-img`
- `test-img`

This is especially relevant for the first bullet; it should be possible to use an image from a private registry (e.g. `my.registry.tld`) which doesn't have a sub-repository (e.g. it is `my.registry.tld/test-img` instead of `my.registry.tld/repo/test-img`).

### What type of installation are you running?

Home Assistant OS

### Which operating system are you running on?

Home Assistant Operating System

### Steps to reproduce the issue

1. Create a custom add-on, specifying the something (valid) formatted like `my.registry.tld/test-img` in `config.yaml`


### Anything in the Supervisor logs that might be useful for us?

title: Home Assistant not reconnecting when router is gone or restarted.
body:
### Describe the issue you are experiencing

My Home assistant on a raspberry is not reconnecting via ethernet eth0.
I use a static ipv4. This only happens when the router is restarted or hung up. In fewer times I had a auto schedule for the router and I was wondering why my HA was not available any more.

I am waiting now 2 years for a solution and nothing happend until now so I start another issue report.
There also other issues on Github which are related to this in a way.

But I want to discuss here very clearly only about the reconnecting issue on eth0 when the router restarts.



### What type of installation are you running?

Home Assistant OS

### Which operating system are you running on?

Home Assistant Operating System

### Steps to reproduce the issue

1. Connecting HA by restarting / starting raspberry
2. Verify connection with ethernet on static IPv4
3. Reboot Router ( Reboot needs probably 1 to 5min depending on the issue / 1 min normal restart / 5 minutes when it is hung up and restarted by a hard reset) 
4. HA is than not reconnecting on eth0



### Anything in the Supervisor logs that might be useful for us?

```txt
Supervisor logs only show that all devices on Wifi are not available
```


### System Health information

None

_No response_

### Additional information

_No response_

4.2.0\n\n## 8.5.2\n\n- Update Home Assistant CLI to 4.1.0\n\n## 8.5.1\n\n- Show warning if SSH port is disabled\n\n## 8.5.0\n\n- Add support for PulseAudio with new Audio backend\n- Migrate to s6-overlay\n\n## 8.4.0\n\n- Support to use only web terminal without SSH server\n\n**ATTENTION:** If you want access with SSH, you need maybe add the Port setting option back.\n\n## 8.3.0\n\n- Update Home Assistant CLI to 4.0.1\n- Add backward compatibility with the hassio command\n- Update Web terminal to ttyd 1.6.0 with Libwebsockets 3.2.2\n- Rename HASSIO_TOKEN to SUPERVISOR_TOKEN in shell profile\n\n## 8.2.0\n\n- Fix creation of new tmux terminal windows\n- Add add-on icon\n- Update welcome logo\n- Fix SSH folder issue with authorized keys\n\n## 8.1.0\n\n- Fix for non existing .bash_profile startup error\n- Add current, short, path to command line prompt\n\n## 8.0.0\n\n- Add support for a web-based terminal via Ingress\n- Upgrade Alpine Linux to 3.11\n- Improve Hass.io API token handling\n- Persist .ssh folder across restarts\n- Add helper symlink folders to user home folder\n"
        },

        "core_samba": {
          "name": "Samba share",
          "slug": "core_samba",
          "version": "10.0.0",
          "version_latest": "10.0.0",
          "update_available": false,
          "state": "started",
          "repository": "Official add-ons",
          "icon": true,
          "cpu_percent": 0.28,
          "memory_usage": 11530240,
          "memory_limit": 966230016,
          "memory_percent": 1.19,
          "network_rx": 0,
          "network_tx": 0,
          "blk_read": 0,
          "blk_write": 0,
          "auto_update": false,
          "changelog": "# Changelog\n\n## 10.0.0\n\nBREAKING CHANGE: Don't mangle filenames\n\nBy default, Samba mangles filenames with special characters to ensure\ncompatibility with really old versions of Windows which have a very limited\ncharset for filenames. The add-on no longer does this as modern operating\nsystems do not have these restrictions.\n\n- Don't mangle filenames (fixes #2541)\n- Upgrade Alpine Linux to 3.16\n\n## 9.7.0\n\n- Upgrade Alpine Linux to 3.15\n- Sign add-on with Codenotary Community Attestation Service (CAS)\n\n## 9.6.1\n\n- Remove lo from interface list\n- Exit with error if there are no supported interfaces to run Samba on\n\n## 9.6.0\n\n- Run on all supported interfaces\n\n## 9.5.1\n\n- Add `hassio_api` to add-on configuration\n\n## 9.5.0\n\n- Remove interface options in favor of network\n\n## 9.4.0\n\n- Upgrade Alpine Linux to 3.13\n- Rewrite configuration generation code\n\n## 9.3.1\n\n- Update options schema for passwords\n\n## 9.3.0\n\n- Support new media folder\n- Update Samba to 4.12.6\n- Upgrade Alpine Linux to 3.12\n\n## 9.2.0\n\n- Pin base image version\n- Rewrite add-on onto S6 Overlay\n- Use default configuration location\n- Add support for running in compatibility mode (SMB1/NT1)\n- Add dummy files to reduce number of errors/warnings in log output\n\n## 9.1.0\n\n- Allow IPv6 link-local hosts by default, consistent with IPv4\n\n## 9.0.0\n\n- New option `veto_files` to limit writing of specified files to the share\n\n## 8.3.0\n\n- Fixes a bug in warning log message, causing start failure\n- Minor code cleanups\n\n## 8.2.0\n\n- Update from bash to bashio\n\n## 8.1.0\n\n- Update Samba to version 4.8.8\n\n## 8.0.0\n\n- Fix access to /backup\n\n"
        }

title: How long to update?
body:
### Describe the issue you are experiencing

Hello,
I ran the update 4 hours ago to version 2022.11.0
to the latest version 2022.11.2 and it is still installing.

Usually it takes 1 minute.

Is there a problem ?

How to see what is blocking?

Thanks.

### What type of installation are you running?

Home Assistant Supervised

### Which operating system are you running on?

Other (e.g., Raspbian/Raspberry Pi OS/Fedora)

### Steps to reproduce the issue

1- open menu Home Assistant Supervisor Update
2- click install


### Anything in the Supervisor logs that might be useful for us?

```txt
no error
```


### System Health information

empty

### Supervisor diagnostics

None

### Additional information

_No response_

title: HomeAssistant sends 15-20 req per *second* to 1.1.1.1 and 1.0.0.1
body: ### Describe the issue you are experiencing While DNS is surely important for HASS contacting a 3-rd party provider without my constant is not cool. However it looks like this is [ignored](https://github.com/home-assistant/supervisor/issues/2139) and not seen as a [privacy problem](https://github.com/home-assistant/supervisor/issues/2437). Fair enough, but why is HASS essentially performing a **SYN flood attack**: `ha dns logs` confirms that indeed it's HASS making these requests in some sort of a loop: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1227834/203453375-53f0363f-5ab6-4675-bcba-059d2c1faa4f.png) This to me seems like at least a bug - it shouldn't be happening 15-20x a second. Moreover HASS receives and uses the DHCP-provided DNS, so there's completely no reason for the instance to query `1.1.1.1` and `1.0.0.1`. ### What type of installation are you running? Home Assistant OS ### Which operating system are you running on? Home Assistant Operating System ### Steps to reproduce the issue 1. Block outbound connections from HASS to `TCP/853` 2. Observe outgoing traffic ### Anything in the Supervisor logs that might be useful for us? ```txt N/A ``` ### System Health information N/A ### Supervisor diagnostics _No response_ ### Additional information _No response_

all 3 hass servers are on virtualbox windows

- server 2 running on hass os 9.3 2022-11-2

All 3 servers are in start up state and having 1 same error in supervisor.

I did see on all systems that the new supervisor was available, together with a couple of add-ons.
When pressing to update first fupervisor on all 3 systems it keeps loading for ages.

So i restarted all 3 systems, only 2 did restart 1 blocked and said somthing about a start state in the terminal, so i manually rebooted it.

I can ping to 1.1.1.1 and 1.0.0.1 all good, also internet is good.

title: Can't connect to Wifi on Pi4 (Error: Connection activation failed: (7) Secrets were required, but not provided)
body:
### Describe the issue you are experiencing

I can't for the life of me connect to wifi (while connected via ethernet). Several other devices are connected so it should not be a problem with the router.

If I try to use the UI interface, I can scan the network, select the SSID, put the password but when trying to save, I get:

```
Logger: homeassistant.components.hassio
Source: components/hassio/websocket_api.py:124
Integration: Home Assistant Supervisor ([documentation](https://www.home-assistant.io/integrations/hassio), [issues](https://github.com/home-assistant/home-assistant/issues?q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aopen+label%3A%22integration%3A+hassio%22))
First occurred: 1:48:23 PM (1 occurrences)
Last logged: 1:48:23 PM

Failed to to call /network/interface/wlan0/update - Activating connection failed, check connection settings.
```

If I try to use the `ha network` command, I get the same error of when using the UI.

If I try to use the method on [this page](https://community.home-assistant.io/t/guide-connecting-pi-with-home-assistant-os-to-wifi-or-other-networking-changes/98768), I get:

```
Error: Connection activation failed: (7) Secrets were required, but not provided.
```

I'm sure the password is correct. Several nmcli commands all return OK, but it can't connect.
The directory `/etc/NetworkManager/system-connections` is always empty and gets overwritten at boot (all contents erased).

**The really odd part: if I use the CONFIG/network file on a USB stick during boot [described here](https://github.com/home-assistant/operating-system/blob/dev/Documentation/network.md), the connection works!!!** But it doesn't survive a reboot without the USB.

This all leds me to think it's something at the Supervisor level which handles all that.
`nmcli` shows me the 2 default connections setup at boot `Supervisor eth0` and `Supervisor wlan0` but I can't start the second.

My goal is to have ethernet and wlan0 connected at the same time. Ethernet for management and wlan0 to access devices.

It seems all documentation available are not updated to the latest version of HA OS and Supervisor.
Is there any lead I can follow on how all this works?

### What operating system image do you use?

rpi4-64  (Raspberry Pi 4/400 64-bit OS)

### What version of Home Assistant Operating System is installed?

9.3

### Did you upgrade the Operating System.

No

### Steps to reproduce the issue

1. Try to connect to wifi using the UI

or try to connect any other methods described above.

### Anything in the Supervisor logs that might be useful for us?

```txt
Nope
```


### Anything in the Host logs that might be useful for us?

title: Supervisor in devcontainer not discovering local add-ons
body:
### Describe the issue you are experiencing

I cloned a fresh copy of the addons-example repository. After fixing some permissions issues in the dev container found in #3969 I managed to get home assistant running in the container with the vscode task. 

As the example repo comes with an example add-on I tried to find it in the add-on store. Unfortunately it doesn't show up as a local add-on, even though I enabled advanced mode on my profile. 

### What type of installation are you running?

Home Assistant Supervised

### Which operating system are you running on?

Other (e.g., Raspbian/Raspberry Pi OS/Fedora)

### Steps to reproduce the issue

1. Clone a fresh copy of the example add-ons repository:
`git clone https://github.com/home-assistant/addons-example`
2. Open the directory in vscode but DO NOT open the window in the container as asked by the pop-up
3. Add `sudo -u root -g root ` to the `postStartCommand` property in `.devcontainer.json` and to the `command` property in `.vscode/tasks.json` to get the container and home assistant running:
    2.1. tasks.json
           ```
           "command": "sudo -u root -g root supervisor_run",
           ```
    2.2. .devcontainer.json
        ```
        "postStartCommand": "sudo -u root -g root bash devcontainer_bootstrap",
        ```
4. Now click on the option to open the window in the container and let it build
5. Run the Home Assistant task in vscode to start it
6. Setup home assistant
7. Turn on advanced mode in your home assistant profile
8. Go to the add-on store and check for updates
9. No local add-on shows up

title: Run initialization and Supervisor launch as root

<!--
  Describe the big picture of your changes here to communicate to the
  maintainers why we should accept this pull request. If it fixes a bug

title: RPI4 -> NUC : unable to restore full backup (Home Assistant OS)
body:
### Describe the issue you are experiencing

I'm trying to migrate from a RPI4 to an Intel Nuc. For this I created a full backup of the RPI4.
I copied the OS to the NUC ssd and booted. On the User Creation page i selected to restore a full backup.

I get error messages in Edge console:
https://imgur.com/MKmeIpH

In the Home Assistant CLI, i look at the Core logs and there is a http error:
invalid config for [http]: not a file for dictionary value @ data['http']['ssl_certificate']. Got '/ssl/fullchain.pem'

Home Assistant OS

title: Unable to load the panel source: /api/hassio/app/entrypoint.js for all add-ons
body:
### Describe the issue you are experiencing

* Ingress add-on pages in sidebar stop working (See error in Title)
* Lights via deCONZ addon stop functioning
* 'update'-sensors go unavailable
* /backups doesn't load, shows 'Could not load the Supervisor panel!'
* Unable to navigate with 'C' button on keyboard, (keeps loading...), 'E' still works.

HA Observer reports all healthy:


Supervisor: | Connected
-- | --
Supported: | Supported
Healthy: | Healthy

After restarting HA Core from the CLI it recovers.

It happens after some random amount of uptime, but I haven't been able to figure it out what resource I'm running out of.
(i.e. memory or filedescriptors)


### What is the used version of the Supervisor?

supervisor-2022.09.1

### What type of installation are you running?

Home Assistant OS

Home Assistant Operating System

### What is the version of your installed operating system?

9.0

core-2022.09.7

1. Leave it running

title: DBus error after new installer
body:
### Describe the issue you are experiencing

Hi,

I've new installer 
Home Assistant 2022.9.7
Supervisor 2022.09.2
Frontend 20220907.2 - latest, 
and now the following error is shown in the Supervisor log (I can't install addon, restore,...):

22-09-29 09:36:11 ERROR (MainThread) [asyncio] Task exception was never retrieved
future: <Task finished name='Task-500' coro=<DBus.call_dbus() done, defined at /usr/src/supervisor/supervisor/utils/dbus.py:78> exception=TypeError("ProxyInterface._add_property.<locals>.property_setter() got an unexpected keyword argument 'unpack_variants'")>

2022.09.2

title: "Unhealthy" state can't be recovered remotely in a default setup
body:
### Describe the issue you are experiencing

I also filed an issue on core repository about this (https://github.com/home-assistant/core/issues/78973). When a power cycle happens at home, Internet usually comes back up later than RPi4+HassOS. That apparently forces a "Unhealthy" state as I understand (because the documentation is very limited and mostly specific to certain components).

When RPi4+HassOS becomes Unhealthy, it's impossible to fix that state remotely using the UI. Only fix option is to use "Terminal & SSH" add-on, which isn't available in a default setup. You can't even install that add-on after the fact because add-on installs are blocked by Unhealthy state.

Restarting HA Core doesn't fix this issue. Restarting HA Supervisor isn't available in the UI.

This is such an unacceptable problem in the operating flow of Home Assistant. I say, HA Supervisor should be able to automatically recover from problems created by missing Internet connection during startup. It should never require manual intervention. Unhealthy should explicitly be reserved for truly unrecoverable phases. 

### What is the used version of the Supervisor?

supervisor-2022.09.1

### What type of installation are you running?

Home Assistant OS

### Which operating system are you running on?

Home Assistant Operating System

### What is the version of your installed operating system?

There's no supervisor panel, and System tab doesn't show this information.

### What version of Home Assistant Core is installed?

core-2022.9.5

### Steps to reproduce the issue

1. Experience power loss at home.
2. Supervisor becomes Unhealthy.

### Anything in the Supervisor logs that might be useful for us?

```txt
Failed to to call /addons/core_ssh/install - 'AddonManager.install' blocked from execution, system is not healthy
```
```


### Additional information

_No response_

title: Use of constant on JobConditions eliminates job condition control
body:
### Describe the issue you are experiencing

Use of the constant ADDON_UPDATE_CONDITIONS rather than explicit list of interpreted conditions eliminates ability to turn off job condition (e.g. "healthy").

Change:

diff --git a/supervisor/addons/__init__.py b/supervisor/addons/__init__.py
index 6efb4a52..04cdd08c 100644
--- a/supervisor/addons/__init__.py
+++ b/supervisor/addons/__init__.py
@@ -145,7 +145,13 @@ class AddonManager(CoreSysAttributes):
                 self.sys_capture_exception(err)
 
     @Job(
-        conditions=ADDON_UPDATE_CONDITIONS,
+        conditions=[
+    JobCondition.FREE_SPACE,
+    JobCondition.HEALTHY,
+    JobCondition.INTERNET_HOST,
+    JobCondition.PLUGINS_UPDATED,
+    JobCondition.SUPERVISOR_UPDATED,
+],
         on_condition=AddonsJobError,
     )
     async def install(self, slug: str) -> None:
@@ -243,7 +249,13 @@ class AddonManager(CoreSysAttributes):
         _LOGGER.info("Add-on '%s' successfully removed", slug)
 
     @Job(
-        conditions=ADDON_UPDATE_CONDITIONS,
+        [
+    JobCondition.FREE_SPACE,
+    JobCondition.HEALTHY,
+    JobCondition.INTERNET_HOST,
+    JobCondition.PLUGINS_UPDATED,
+    JobCondition.SUPERVISOR_UPDATED,
+],
         on_condition=AddonsJobError,
     )
     async def update(self, slug: str, backup: bool | None = False) -> None:


### What is the used version of the Supervisor?

2022.09.1

### What type of installation are you running?

Home Assistant OS

### Which operating system are you running on?

Home Assistant Operating System

### What is the version of your installed operating system?

9.0

### What version of Home Assistant Core is installed?

2022.09.7

### Steps to reproduce the issue

Attempt to change job condition healthy to ignore; find that is it not ignored.

diff --git a/supervisor/addons/__init__.py b/supervisor/addons/__init__.py
index 6efb4a52..04cdd08c 100644
--- a/supervisor/addons/__init__.py
+++ b/supervisor/addons/__init__.py
@@ -145,7 +145,13 @@ class AddonManager(CoreSysAttributes):
                 self.sys_capture_exception(err)
 
     @Job(
-        conditions=ADDON_UPDATE_CONDITIONS,
+        conditions=[
+    JobCondition.FREE_SPACE,
+    JobCondition.HEALTHY,
+    JobCondition.INTERNET_HOST,
+    JobCondition.PLUGINS_UPDATED,
+    JobCondition.SUPERVISOR_UPDATED,
+],
         on_condition=AddonsJobError,
     )
     async def install(self, slug: str) -> None:
@@ -243,7 +249,13 @@ class AddonManager(CoreSysAttributes):
         _LOGGER.info("Add-on '%s' successfully removed", slug)
 
     @Job(
-        conditions=ADDON_UPDATE_CONDITIONS,
+        [
+    JobCondition.FREE_SPACE,
+    JobCondition.HEALTHY,
+    JobCondition.INTERNET_HOST,
+    JobCondition.PLUGINS_UPDATED,
+    JobCondition.SUPERVISOR_UPDATED,
+],
         on_condition=AddonsJobError,
     )
     async def update(self, slug: str, backup: bool | None = False) -> None:



### Anything in the Supervisor logs that might be useful for us?

```txt
Warning is emitted as expected, but condition is not ignored.
```


### Additional information

title: ZWaveJS2MQTT Add-on not updated to ZWave JS UI
body:
### Describe the issue you are experiencing

ZWaveJS2MQTT was recently renamed to ZWave JS UI, and as part of that the HA community add-on was renamed to have the new name, and had it's version bumped from 0.4.7 to 1.0.0.

On one of my Home Assistant systems, I'm not offered the update.  I've forced checking for updates in the addon store numerous times, but ZWaveJS2MQTT still shows as version 0.4.7 with no update available, and ZWave JS UI does not appear as an option.

On another system I administer, the update was offered as normal the the name change occured seamlessly.  Other users also [report that the update worked correctly for them](https://community.home-assistant.io/t/psa-zwavejs2mqtt-has-been-renamed-to-z-wave-js-ui/463605/15?u=imsorrybutwho).  I'm not sure what's going differently here.

Looking over debug ssh, I can see that /mnt/data/supervisor/addons/git/a0d7b954/ has directories for both zwavejs2mqtt and zwave-js-ui, so I believe the update data is being downloaded, just not presented for some reason.

Nothing relevant appears in the Supervisor log.

### What is the used version of the Supervisor?

Supervisor 2022.09.1

### What type of installation are you running?

Home Assistant OS

### Which operating system are you running on?

Home Assistant Operating System

### What is the version of your installed operating system?

Operating System 9.0

### What version of Home Assistant Core is installed?

Home Assistant 2022.9.6

### Steps to reproduce the issue

Unsure how to reproduce.

title: Static DNS entry lost from config after update to Supervisor 2022.09.1
body:
### Describe the issue you are experiencing

I had a static IPV4 config in place prior the recent updates. After updating to Supervisor 2022.09.1, I began getting failures trying to update Add-ons. 

‘AddonManager.update’ blocked from execution, no host internet connection”.

I discovered that the DNS server in my IPv4 config had been removed. Adding it back in resolved the issue. 

### What is the used version of the Supervisor?

2022.09.1

### What type of installation are you running?

Home Assistant OS

### Which operating system are you running on?

Home Assistant Operating System

### What is the version of your installed operating system?

9.0

### What version of Home Assistant Core is installed?

2022.9.5

### Steps to reproduce the issue

1. update to Supervisor 2022.09.1
2. try to use any function that relies on name resolution like updating an add-on
3.consider if it was you that messed it up... no, it was the update that caused it.

title: supervisor doesn't restart node-red
body:
### Describe the issue you are experiencing

With the addon watchdog enabled, a crashed addon (node-red) does not get restarted. This is the same issue identified in https://github.com/home-assistant/supervisor/issues/3812 is still present with Supervisor 2022.09.1 which includes the fix https://github.com/home-assistant/supervisor/pull/3815 .





### What is the used version of the Supervisor?

Supervisor-2022.09.1

### What type of installation are you running?

Home Assistant OS

### Which operating system are you running on?

Home Assistant Operating System

### What is the version of your installed operating system?

9.0

### What version of Home Assistant Core is installed?

core-2022.9.4

crash addon

title: "ha network vlan" API broken in 2022.08.6
body:
### Describe the issue you are experiencing

Attempts to create a new vlan using the "ha" cli fails with: `ERRO[0000] Unexpected server response`

Based on error in supervisor logs, I believe the changes in https://github.com/home-assistant/supervisor/pull/3828 may be the culprit - a new `ready` attribute was introduced to IpConfig but was not added to all instantiations of IpConfig - including in the API when creating a new VLAN.

### What is the used version of the Supervisor?

2022.08.6

### What type of installation are you running?

Home Assistant OS

### Which operating system are you running on?

Home Assistant Operating System

### What is the version of your installed operating system?

8.5

### What version of Home Assistant Core is installed?

2022.9.2

### Steps to reproduce the issue

1. From the terminal within Home Assistant Frontend try to create a new VLAN using the "ha" cli, eg. `ha network vlan enp98s0 31 --ipv4-method auto --ipv6-method auto`

Expected:
Command to complete successfully.

Observed:
`ERRO[0000] Unexpected server response`


### Anything in the Supervisor logs that might be useful for us?

```txt

    raise value

    response = await old_handle(self, request)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.10/site-packages/aiohttp/web_app.py", line 504, in _handle
    resp = await handler(request)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.10/site-packages/aiohttp/web_middlewares.py", line 117, in impl
    return await handler(request)
  File "/usr/src/supervisor/supervisor/api/middleware/security.py", line 138, in system_validation
    return await handler(request)

title: Latest supervisor update broken networking
body:
### Describe the issue you are experiencing

Using a netbooted diskless raspberry pi4 system running a supervised-install - https://github.com/home-assistant/supervised-installer - like that.

As of today the system loses it's IP address shortly after starting the supervisor and will never recover.

I cannot reach the web UI to pull version information - it is up to date.

### What is the used version of the Supervisor?

2022.08.6

### What type of installation are you running?

Home Assistant Supervised

### Which operating system are you running on?

Debian

### What is the version of your installed operating system?

11.4

### What version of Home Assistant Core is installed?

2022.9.0

### Steps to reproduce the issue

1.boot the box
2.wait
3.fail


### Anything in the Supervisor logs that might be useful for us?

```txt
Unable to access the logs
```


### Additional information

This setup has been working for years - like home assistant 0.66 or something like that.  I have no idea why a booted working system having it's network checked causes it to go offline but based on the changes being network related I'm blaming these changes.

https://github.com/home-assistant/supervisor/pull/3828
https://github.com/home-assistant/supervisor/pull/3829
https://github.com/home-assistant/supervisor/pull/3830

It does effect multiple systems I have running this config.

title: https client traffic not directed to NGINX Home Assistant SSL proxy
body:
### Describe the issue you are experiencing

Not sure if this a supervisor issue or something in the add-on, but since last night my Home Assistant instance was not accessible over port 443 which should direct to the NGINX Home Assistant SSL proxy add-on. 

When running a tcpdump network trace I saw that the IP where https traffic was heading to belonged to the Visual Studio Code add-on. 

I was able to recover from this by doing this:
1. Stop both the Visual Studio Code add-on and NGINX Home Assistant SSL proxy add-on 
2. Start the NGINX Home Assistant SSL proxy add-on first 
3. Start the Visual Studio Code add-on 

I do not know how this could hapen, only I saw that there was an update for the Visual Studio Code add-on and that this particular container was restarted last night. I does not explain for me why it had port 443 directed to that container. As far as I see it does not doe anything with that port.

### What is the used version of the Supervisor?

supervisor-2022.08.3

Home Assistant Supervised

Debian

11.4

20220802.0

I cannot reproduce.

title: nodered says via the web interface that it is not running but the automations are all running
body:
### Describe the issue you are experiencing

When I open the web interface of nodered I get the message: Add-on is not running. please start first.
If I then click ok I get to the addon screen of nodered and then I can click on start whatever I want but nothing changes. When I then look in the logs I see that nodered has just started, which also shows that the automations that I have made in nodered just work. However, I can't get into the web interface.

### What is the used version of the Supervisor?

Supervisor 2022.07.1

### What type of installation are you running?

Home Assistant OS

### Which operating system are you running on?

Home Assistant Operating System

### What is the version of your installed operating system?

Operating System 8.4

### What version of Home Assistant Core is installed?

core-2022.7.7

### Steps to reproduce the issue

I have no idea how to repoduce this.
I've done my updates every time but haven't been working on nodered for a while. So I can't say when this first occurred. I did try to restore a backup from a week ago but it didn't work either.
I even removed the addon completely and reinstalled it, but that also had no effect.

title: Community add-ons are not visible in the HA frontend, but cannot be added as the repo is already stored
body:
### Describe the issue you are experiencing

I hope I am placing this bug in the right place, but it might be a HA OS issue.

Last week I experienced an issue where the community add-ons were not visible in the HA frontend, but if I tried to add the community repo I received an error telling me that the repo was already added. 

I ended up resolving the issue by editing `/mnt/data/supervisor/store.json` and removing the `https://github.com/hassio-addons/repository` entry and then rebooting the host. After that, I was able to add and use the community addons. 

I assumed this was down to my error or poor connectivity. But numerous HA reboots (including rebooting the host) did not resolve it until I edited the file. And then today in the Home Assistant Discord another user encountered the same issue, hence raising a bug report.

### What is the used version of the Supervisor?

supervisor-2022.07.0

### What type of installation are you running?

Home Assistant OS

### Which operating system are you running on?

Home Assistant Operating System

### What is the version of your installed operating system?

5.11

### What version of Home Assistant Core is installed?

Home Assistant OS 8.2

### Steps to reproduce the issue

Unfortunately, I don't know what caused this. But I have some things that may be useful to know:

I set HA up in May, and then it was offline until last week, when I updated to the latest releases of HA OS, Supervisor, and Core on 2022-07-18.

I did have issues with GitHub repeatedly being "unavailable" which appeared to be the device/network being banned from the GitHub API for overwhelming it with requests (I installed HACS on 2022-07-18 too).

### Anything in the Supervisor logs that might be useful for us?

```txt
Unfortunately not.
```


### Additional information

_No response_

title: Addons don't get access to IPv6 after a system reboot
body:
### Describe the issue you are experiencing

Hello, I noticed that when I restart my host (RPi4), mostly after a power outage, all the addons will not get access to the IPv6 interface, and I have to restart them all to fix the issue. Most of them don't require access to IPv6, but there are some that do, like AdGuard and DuckDNS.

This is probably due to the fact that my RPi doesn't have an IPv6 yet when it starts the addons (the IPv4 is static, so there are no issues with that), and then there is no check after it gets it from the internet (my router is a Fritz!Box 7590, running in dualstack).





### What is the used version of the Supervisor?

supervisor-2022.07.0

### What type of installation are you running?

Home Assistant OS

### Which operating system are you running on?

Home Assistant Operating System

### What is the version of your installed operating system?

8.2

### What version of Home Assistant Core is installed?

core-2022.7.6

### Steps to reproduce the issue

1. System is running
2. Reboot Host
3. Wait for Home Assistant
4. Check addons
5. There is no reference of IPv6 interface
6. Reboot addons
7. Everything is back to normal


### Anything in the Supervisor logs that might be useful for us?

```txt
The Supervisor doesn't report any issue.

title: USB's keep disconnecting from HA; HCI mismatch
body:
### Describe the issue you are experiencing

Intel NUC with Win10

VirtualBox - 6.1

Home Assistant Core 2022.6.7

Home Assistant Supervisor 2022.07.0

Home Assistant OS 8.2

I have 2 USBs: one for ZigBee (Conbee II) and one for ZWave (Zooz 700). They are setup as USB and not serial within VB.


Every few weeks, my USB's stop working. I cannot tell if this is on the NUC, VB, or HA since the moment HA starts up, the USB's disappear from my PC's Device Manager.

Error on Host Logs: I'm not sure what the HCI is but it looks like a mismatch caused the HCI host to stop responding which caused the USB to disconnect, so the converter disconnected. I don't know how each of these interact with one another, so I'm a bit lost.

### What is the used version of the Supervisor?

supervisor-2022.07.0

### What type of installation are you running?

Home Assistant OS

### Which operating system are you running on?

Home Assistant Operating System

### What is the version of your installed operating system?

Home Assistant OS 8.2

### What version of Home Assistant Core is installed?

core-2022.6.7

### Steps to reproduce the issue

Reproducing is a bit difficult as the issue seems random. This happens every 3-4 weeks of HA running. One day, the USB's just disconnect, so ZWave and Zigbee go down. 

I cannot tell if this is on the NUC, VB, or HA since the moment HA starts up, the USB's disappear from my PC's Device Manager.

Error on Host Logs: I'm not sure what the HCI is but it looks like a mismatch caused the HCI host to stop responding which caused the USB to disconnect, so the converter disconnected. I don't know how each of these interact with one another, so I'm a bit lost.

```
[ 273.507088] xhci_hcd 0000:00:0c.0: ERROR mismatched command completion event

[ 273.570943] xhci_hcd 0000:00:0c.0: ERROR mismatched command completion event

[ 275.954474] xhci_hcd 0000:00:0c.0: ERROR mismatched command completion event

[ 278.531048] xhci_hcd 0000:00:0c.0: ERROR mismatched command completion event

[ 321.545063] xhci_hcd 0000:00:0c.0: ERROR mismatched command completion event

[ 321.545506] xhci_hcd 0000:00:0c.0: ERROR mismatched command completion event

[ 326.658164] xhci_hcd 0000:00:0c.0: ERROR mismatched command completion event

[ 326.659284] xhci_hcd 0000:00:0c.0: xHCI host not responding to stop endpoint command.

[ 326.659348] xhci_hcd 0000:00:0c.0: USBSTS: 0x00000000

[ 326.660150] xhci_hcd 0000:00:0c.0: xHCI host controller not responding, assume dead

[ 326.661414] xhci_hcd 0000:00:0c.0: HC died; cleaning up

[ 326.662938] usb 1-1: USB disconnect, device number 2

[ 326.662979] cp210x ttyUSB0: failed set request 0x7 status: -19

[ 326.663162] cp210x ttyUSB0: failed set request 0x12 status: -19

[ 326.663343] cp210x ttyUSB0: failed set request 0x0 status: -19

[ 326.664348] cp210x ttyUSB0: cp210x converter now disconnected from ttyUSB0

[ 326.664502] cp210x 1-1:1.0: device disconnected

[ 326.664769] usb 1-2: USB disconnect, device number 3

[ 326.666633] xhci_hcd 0000:00:0c.0: Slot 2 endpoint 6 not removed from BW list!
```

Reviewing the ZWave JS to MQTT logs, it's showing an error I've definitely worked through before which is really what led me to unplugging and plugging the USB's back in.

```
2022-07-14T12:40:32.253Z DRIVER opening serial port /dev/ttyUSB0

2022-07-14T12:40:41.268Z DRIVER Failed to open the serial port: Error: No such file or directory, cannot open /dev/ttyUSB0
```

I see a similar error for Zigbee2MQTT. It can't connect to the USB:

`Error: Error: No such file or directory, cannot open /dev/serial/by-id/usb-dresden_elektronik_ingenieurtechnik_GmbH_ConBee_II_DE2477219-if00'`

With all that shown, this is the first time I'm seeing the errors for the host controller. Normally it's just the USB's. Now, while the error on the HA Host shows only ttyUSB0, it's actually missing both USB's. Not sure why it's only showing there's an issue with 1.

### Anything in the Supervisor logs that might be useful for us?

```txt
The relevant logs are shown in the Steps to Reproduce section. Supervisor Logs specifically do not note anything related to this issue.
```


### Additional information

To resolve short-term (like I said, this happens every 3-4 weeks), I have to send ACPI Shutdown to the VB, restart the NUC, allow VB and HA to startup, restart HA using the HA command, if this works great, if not, then I have to restart the NUC the normal way. Then it's usually resolved. Sometimes, I have to reseat the two USB's.

title: follow-up: Query URL max length of 8190 bytes is critical in ingress/add-on use
body:
### Describe the issue you are experiencing

In an old automatically closed issue (https://github.com/home-assistant/supervisor/issues/3137) I was already reporting on issues with long query URLs. This issue still exists in HomeAssistant / supervisor. 

The issue being, that there are applications like HA add-ons (e.g. RaspberryMatic HA Addon) which will issue URL queries to ingress with >8k long URL query lines. When doing so, ingress/HA returns an error like:

```
Got more than 8190 bytes (13390) when reading Status line is too long.
```

and aborts the connection. This ends up in partly broken functionality.

As suggested in the old issue, increasing the `max_line_size` and `max_field_size` in `aiohttp/http_parser.py` might already solve this issue. Thus, increasing these two constant (cf. https://github.com/aio-libs/aiohttp/blob/master/aiohttp/http_parser.py#L127-L128 and https://github.com/aio-libs/aiohttp/blob/master/aiohttp/http_parser.py#L222-L223)  to, e.g. 24k should be enough to solve this issue.

Therefore, I would like to ask (@pvizeli ?) to increase these max sizes to > 8k so that add-ons like RaspberryMatic do not end up with broken functionality in their WebUI just because ingress is not allowing longer query urls.

### What is the used version of the Supervisor?

supervisor-2022.07.0

### What type of installation are you running?

Home Assistant OS

### Which operating system are you running on?

Home Assistant Operating System

### What is the version of your installed operating system?

8.2

### What version of Home Assistant Core is installed?

core-2022.7.3

### Steps to reproduce the issue

1. Send >8k long Query URLs through an ingress routes web interface (e.g. through an add-on) or 
2. Note `Got more than 8190 bytes (13390) when reading Status line is too long.` to appear in the browser console.


### Anything in the Supervisor logs that might be useful for us?

```txt
n/a
```


### Additional information

see https://github.com/home-assistant/supervisor/issues/3137

title: NetworkManager auto connect disabled
body:
### Describe the issue you are experiencing

I have noticed some issues with NetworkManager on Home Assistant supervised, I began looking into this today and created the supervised installer PR https://github.com/home-assistant/supervised-installer/pull/224 which brings the supervised installer up to date with the Home Assistant OS PR https://github.com/home-assistant/operating-system/pull/1813 which solves part of the issue

However the new config file that is generated by the supervisor does not have the auto connect option enabled, meaning that on reboot the network connection is lost.

The current work around which works for me and others appears to be to enable the auto connect option manually using `nmcli` or `nmtui` as per issue https://github.com/home-assistant/supervised-installer/issues/217

### What is the used version of the Supervisor?

Supervisor 2022.07.0

### What type of installation are you running?

Home Assistant Supervised

### Which operating system are you running on?

Debian

### What is the version of your installed operating system?

5.10.0-16-amd64

### What version of Home Assistant Core is installed?

core-2022.7.3

### Steps to reproduce the issue

1. Install Home Assistant Supervised
2. Reboot
3. Attempt to ping anything, you will not have network connectivity until you enable auto connect 

### Anything in the Supervisor logs that might be useful for us?

```txt
Jul 11 22:29:43 ha-su-deb 63dcfc3cc0bf[1103]: 22-07-11 22:29:43 INFO (MainThread) [supervisor.host.network] Updating local network information
```


### Additional information
Upon reboot

I reinstall HA and try to restore after moving the backup file to the backup folder with smaba addon. However, the backup file cannot be retrieved by the supervisor.

### What is the used version of the Supervisor?

supervisor-2022.05.3

### What type of installation are you running?

Home Assistant OS

### Which operating system are you running on?

Home Assistant Operating System

### What is the version of your installed operating system?

8.2

### What version of Home Assistant Core is installed?

core-2022.6.7

### Steps to reproduce the issue

1. Move the backup file to the backup folder with smaba addon.
2. The supervisor displays the following error message

Can't validate data for /data/backup/Full Backup 2022-06-28.tar: expected a URL @ data['repositories'][3]. Got 'core'
expected a URL @ data['repositories'][5]. Got 'local'

Can't read backup tarfile /data/backup/909c27c6.tar: "filename './backup.json' not found"

title: Error: Activating connection failed, check connection settings - While attempting to change IP address
body:
### Describe the issue you are experiencing

Here is the original issue, which is now closed: https://github.com/home-assistant/supervisor/issues/3610

I'm still having the same issue even after switching to beta and upgrading Supervisor to 2022.06.1. 
```
[core-ssh ~]$ ha network update wlan0 --ipv4-method static --ipv4-address 192.168.0.89/24
Error: Activating connection failed, check connection settings.
```
With debug logging:
```

title: Move data not possible because (internal) S2 ssd not seen as drive
body: ### Describe the issue you are experiencing using a [Mele mini pc](https://www.mele.cn/PCHD28/124-en.html) with 128 gb emmc in the box, I run HAOS without problems. Decided to add a M.2 SSD and move the data to that drive. Inserted the SSD directly into the slot, did not format, nor set anything in BIOS. (believing the OS would take care of all that on the Data move. Boots successfully, but the drive is not seen as option in the Move data, where only /dev/sda is offered which cant be done because: My guess is this is the actual active partition, so that error message is correct. the S2 NVMe drive is seen in All Hardware: and all details seem in order: Shelling in with -p 22222 `fdisk -l` results in ### What is the used version of the Supervisor? supervisor-2022.06.dev2101 ### What type of installation are you running? Home Assistant OS ### Which operating system are you running on? Home Assistant Operating System ### What is the version of your installed operating system? Home Assistant OS 8.2 ### What version of Home Assistant Core is installed? core-2022.7.0.dev20220621 ### Steps to reproduce the issue 1. described in the op 2. 3. ... ### Anything in the Supervisor logs that might be useful for us? ```txt nothing. all green ``` ### Additional information after some serious support with pvizeli and falstaff321 I was asked to file an issue in Supervisor this is the sda Ive also tried the "old fashioned" way using `datactl move` as described in [Partition method](https://github.com/home-assistant/operating-system/blob/d42f80c65e8506a6aec0c7f7f9e603107e163faf/Documentation/partition.md#using-datactl-to-move-the-data-partition) but the command isnt recognized: `ha os datadisk list` returns: `ha hw info` results in: [ha hw info.txt](https://github.com/home-assistant/supervisor/files/8951635/ha.hw.info.txt)

title: Backup succeeds on pre/post failure
body:
### Describe the issue you are experiencing

An add-on backup completes, even-though the add-on has pre/post command (that failed).


### What is the used version of the Supervisor?

supervisor-2022.06.dev0903

### What type of installation are you running?

Home Assistant Supervised

### Which operating system are you running on?

Debian

### What is the version of your installed operating system?

Debian 11

### What version of Home Assistant Core is installed?

2022.6.5

### Steps to reproduce the issue

1. Add `mariadb` core add-on to your add-ons folder
2. Replace `backup_post` & `backup_pre` with an invalid command
3. Install and run your local/patched `mariadb` add-on
4. Create a partial backup with only the `mariadb` add-on
5. The backup is created and shown in the interface.
6. Supervisor logs show the error; which the user was not aware of

title: Supervisor not available, Supervisor Retry Setup: Error on Supervisor API:
body:
### Describe the issue you are experiencing

Hi there,
I am running Home Assistant in a VM under Proxmox, successfully for a few years.
Suddenly my Supervisor seems stopped working.
I already tried to reboot the host but had no success...
I also tried to reload, restart or repair the supervisor with no success...
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/49213470/171290897-958fcba4-13ec-4db9-97b6-220e37fb9c3e.png)

For information, I updated my Proxmox Host to the newest version but I am not sure if the problem was already there before.

several weird errors occur:

under settings -> integrations:

under settings -> Add-ons:

under settings -> system -> Logs: (Home Assistant Code)

under settings -> system -> Logs: (SUPERVISOR or any other Logs)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/49213470/171289068-27a26d4b-f194-4abc-9b5c-15b852a16da7.png)

under settings -> system -> backups:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/49213470/171289146-cf5349d6-f2b9-4454-a022-a40e991c329e.png)

under settings -> system -> network:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/49213470/171289317-a0afbcd6-013c-4a68-8316-7d4164761eee.png)

Home Assistant observer:

I never had any problems like that and my whole setup was running stable over years, therefor I really appreciate any help.

title: Core add-ons are missing
body:
### Describe the issue you are experiencing

Core add-ons are missing except from those that were installed when home assisstant itself was installed.
Icons of those add-ons are missing too.

When manually checking add-ons for updates, errors are logged in supervisor log.

This issue is a blocker for me, because there is no way for me to install mosquitto broker and given that I can't use Zigbee2mqtt.

Core add-ons that are installed don't get updated.

### What is the used version of the Supervisor?

supervisor-2022.05.2

### What type of installation are you running?

Home Assistant OS

### Which operating system are you running on?

Home Assistant Operating System

### What is the version of your installed operating system?

5.15.38

### What version of Home Assistant Core is installed?

core-2022.5.5

### Steps to reproduce the issue

1. Go to Settings > Add-ons;
2. Click "Add-on store" button bottom right of the screen;
3. Click three dots top right of the screen;
4. Select "Check for updates" from drop list;
5. Check Supervisor log for errors.

The connected hard drive is seen by the CLI but not by the UI
