title: image definition from an addon doesn't support all variations of a valid image pull expression
body:
### Describe the issue you are experiencing

the `image` section of a `config.yaml` or `config.json` from an add-on allows expressions such as:

- `zigbee2mqtt/zigbee2mqtt-{arch}`
- `ghcr.io/home-assistant/{arch}-addon-example`

But not:

- `orcas.docker-public.orcas.net/zigbee2mqtt-edge-{arch}`

This results in an error like this:

`22-05-17 00:24:58 WARNING (SyncWorker_7) [supervisor.store.data] Can't read /data/addons/git/3be6726f/zigbee2mqtt-edge/config.json: does not match regular expression ^([a-zA-Z\-\.:\d{}]+/)*?([\-\w{}]+)/([\-\w{}]+)$ for dictionary value @ data['image']. Got 'orcas.docker-public.orcas.net/zigbee2mqtt-edge-{arch}'`

`docker pull` will happily accept that as a valid pull location

### What is the used version of the Supervisor?

supervisor-2022.05.2

### What type of installation are you running?

Home Assistant OS

### Which operating system are you running on?

Home Assistant Operating System

### What is the version of your installed operating system?

7.4

### What version of Home Assistant Core is installed?

core-2022.2.9

### Steps to reproduce the issue

1. Add a repo under Configration->Add ons->Add-on store->Respositories that has an addon with an image with dotted hostname, single slash and project name
2. Click on the addon in the add-on store
3. Click "Install" (Errors)
4. Check supervisor log (under configation->add ons->system for above error

I suspect you could repro this the same way by uploading the addon under the /addons directory and trying to install from there.

### Anything in the Supervisor logs that might be useful for us?

```txt
22-05-17 00:24:58 WARNING (SyncWorker_7) [supervisor.store.data] Can't read /data/addons/git/3be6726f/zigbee2mqtt-edge/config.json: does not match regular expression ^([a-zA-Z\-\.:\d{}]+/)*?([\-\w{}]+)/([\-\w{}]+)$ for dictionary value @ data['image']. Got 'orcas.docker-public.orcas.net/zigbee2mqtt-edge-{arch}'
```


### Additional information

_No response_

title: s6 v3 and supervisor do not like when add-on protection mode is disabled
body:
### Describe the issue you are experiencing

# TL;DR

I develop an add-on called [prometheus_node_exporter](https://github.com/loganmarchione/hassos-addons/tree/main/prometheus_node_exporter). I am by no means a professional developer, but was told I may have stumbled upon a bug with the way the new s6 v3 and supervisor handle protection mode being disabled. I was [asked to open an issue](https://community.home-assistant.io/t/hello-world-example-addon-from-developer-docs-stopped-working-s6-overlay-issue/421486/25). See below for steps to re-create.

----

# Long version

This is my first bug report, let me know if you need more info.

**Background**:
* Prometheus [server](https://github.com/prometheus/prometheus) (not my add-on) is a time-series metrics database (similar to influxd).
* Prometheus also creates a client called [node_exporter](https://github.com/prometheus/node_exporter) that exports node data (CPU, memory, disk, etc...) to a Prometheus server.
* My add-on is a Home Assistant version of that node_exporter client. I use it to monitor my Home Assistant virtual machine metrics and export that data to my separate prometheus server instance.
* Side note: If you could integrate node metrics into the [official Prometheus integration](https://www.home-assistant.io/integrations/prometheus/), that would be great and would negate the need for my add-on completely 😅.

**Problem**:
* Like the [glances add-on](https://github.com/hassio-addons/addon-glances), prometheus_node_exporter requires access to host data that is outside of the container. As such, protection mode must be disabled to gather all metrics. It will technically work without protection mode, but it's missing metrics.
* Since the recent [s6 v3 update](https://developers.home-assistant.io/blog/2022/05/12/s6-overlay-base-images), new installs of my add-on have been [reported broken](https://github.com/loganmarchione/hassos-addons/issues/2).
* I took the steps in the blog post, including making my scripts executable and updating my `finish` script. I had already set `init: false`, so that didn't change. However, the add-on still reported `s6-overlay-suexec: fatal: can only run as pid 1`.
* Working with @mdegat01 on the forums, he pointed out that the add-on does appear to try to start when protection mode is enabled. This would point to a bug in the way the new s6 v3 and supervisor handle protection mode being disabled, right?
* I'm guessing glances isn't affected (yet) because it publishes [images](https://github.com/orgs/hassio-addons/packages?repo_name=addon-glances) to GHCR and was last updated in January, whereas my add-on builds the container on each install, so it immediately broke on the s6 v3 update. I should add that this add-on worked fine before the s6 v3 update.


### What is the used version of the Supervisor?

supervisor-2022.05.2

### What type of installation are you running?

Home Assistant OS

### Which operating system are you running on?

Home Assistant Operating System

### What is the version of your installed operating system?

Home Assistant OS 8.0

### What version of Home Assistant Core is installed?

core-2022.5.4

### Steps to reproduce the issue

1. Clone my repo and checkout the s6_v3 branch
```
git clone https://github.com/loganmarchione/hassos-addons.git
cd hassos-addons
git checkout s6_v3
```
2. Copy/paste the `prometheus_node_exporter` directory into the `hassos-addons` folder of your HA instance
3. Install the add-on, **disable protection mode** (this is needed because the add-on requires access to host data), and start it
4. You will see this error and the add-on will crash
```
s6-overlay-suexec: fatal: can only run as pid 1
```
5. Repeat step 3, but **leave protection mode enabled**, and you'll see a different error.
```
s6-rc: info: service s6rc-oneshot-runner: starting
s6-rc: info: service s6rc-oneshot-runner successfully started
s6-rc: info: service fix-attrs: starting
s6-rc: info: service fix-attrs successfully started
s6-rc: info: service legacy-cont-init: starting
cont-init: info: running /etc/cont-init.d/node_exporter.sh
[21:37:26] FATAL: PROTECTION MODE IS ENABLED!
[21:37:26] FATAL: 
[21:37:26] FATAL: To be able to use this add-on, you'll need to disable
[21:37:26] FATAL: protection mode on this add-on. Without it, the add-on
[21:37:26] FATAL: is unable to access Docker.
[21:37:26] FATAL: 
[21:37:26] FATAL: Steps:
[21:37:26] FATAL:  - Go to the Supervisor Panel.
[21:37:26] FATAL:  - Click on this add-on.
[21:37:26] FATAL:  - Set the 'Protection mode' switch to off.
[21:37:26] FATAL:  - Restart the add-on.
[21:37:26] FATAL: 
[21:37:26] FATAL: Access to Docker allows you to do really powerful things
[21:37:26] FATAL: including complete destruction of your system.
[21:37:26] FATAL: Please, be sure you know what you are doing before
[21:37:26] FATAL: enabling this feature (and this add-on)!
[21:37:26] FATAL: 
cont-init: info: /etc/cont-init.d/node_exporter.sh exited 1
cont-init: warning: some scripts exited nonzero
s6-rc: warning: unable to start service legacy-cont-init: command exited 1
/run/s6/basedir/scripts/rc.init: warning: s6-rc failed to properly bring all the services up! Check your logs (in /run/uncaught-logs/current if you have in-container logging) for more information.
/run/s6/basedir/scripts/rc.init: fatal: stopping the container.
s6-rc: info: service fix-attrs: stopping
s6-rc: info: service fix-attrs successfully stopped
s6-rc: info: service s6rc-oneshot-runner: stopping
s6-rc: info: service s6rc-oneshot-runner successfully stopped
```
6. This would point to a bug in the way the new s6 v3 and supervisor handle protection mode being disabled, right?
7. Furthermore, if you stop the add-on, comment out [this line](https://github.com/loganmarchione/hassos-addons/blob/8e84bec82cc06be3ae57bade5d2454bead5cff62/prometheus_node_exporter/rootfs/etc/cont-init.d/node_exporter.sh#L6) to remove the protection mode requirement, save, and re-install the add-on, you'll see it starts. This also confirms that something is happening with s6 v3 and protection mode, right?
```
s6-rc: info: service s6rc-oneshot-runner: starting
s6-rc: info: service s6rc-oneshot-runner successfully started
s6-rc: info: service fix-attrs: starting
s6-rc: info: service fix-attrs successfully started
s6-rc: info: service legacy-cont-init: starting
```

title: Upload backup fails with "unsupported file format" under Firefox for Windows
body:
### Describe the issue you are experiencing

I am not able to restore a backup made by HomeAssistant on a new installation.

Clicking “Alternatively you can restore from a previous backup” and selecting a previous tar backup always results in a pop-up stating “Unsupported file format - Please choose a Home Assistant backup file (.tar)”.

Trying to upload a backup under Settings / Systems / Backups leads to the same error.

### What is the used version of the Supervisor?

2022.05.1

### What type of installation are you running?

Home Assistant OS

### Which operating system are you running on?

Home Assistant Operating System

### What is the version of your installed operating system?

5.10.108

### What version of Home Assistant Core is installed?

2022.5.4

### Steps to reproduce the issue

1. Using HAOS on a Raspberry Pi 3B, I created a backup as follows :
 Went to Settings / System / Backups
 Selected “create backup”
 Waited about a half hour (!) for the backup to be created
2. Once complete, I clicked the vertical … menu, and “download backup” to get the file onto my Windows PC
3. On my PC, fired up the Virtualbox VM running HAOS (Linux)
4.  Logged into http://:8123 in my Firefox browser
5. Clicked “Alternatively you can restore from a previous backup”
6.  Selected the tar backup file I downloaded in step 2
7. I got a pop-up stating “Unsupported file format - Please choose a Home Assistant backup file (.tar)”.
8. I then created a dummy account and went to Settings / System / Backups
9. Using the vertical ... context menu, I clicked "Upload backup" and selected the tar file from step 2
10. I got the same error as in step 7



### Anything in the Supervisor logs that might be useful for us?

```txt
N/A
```


### Additional information

I installed the SSH add-on and uploaded the tar backup to HAOS using WinSCP, and was then able to restore it successfully. This proves that the backup file itself wasn't the issue. It looks like there may be a problem with the backup file upload process.

The browsing I'm using is Firefox 100.0 on Windows x64, FYI.

In thread https://community.home-assistant.io/t/moving-haos-to-a-different-hardware-platform/421608/6, other users mentioned that there was a bug in the past related to backup file size. I'm not sure if this is the same problem I'm experiencing here.
The tar backup file is 715 MB in size.

title: Home Assistant OS loses network connectivity when Ethernet goes down (router reboot)
body:
### Describe the issue you are experiencing

## TL;DR:

Home Assistant OS completely loses connectivity if the router reboots.

## Detailed description:

My router is "fairly modern" TP-Link Archer AX-50 router and when I setup it a year ago there was this option to nightly reboot, which I selected because I'm a developer and I know memory leak is a real thing and why not let it reboot every night at 4AM.

I never had problems with the nightly reboot. Chromecast, PowerLine network, different raspberry PIs (mini-DLNA, piHole, camera) that I have around, everything would just work. It would reboot and in the morning I wouldn't have known because everything just works.

A month or so ago I got started with Home Assistant, so it's currently a small setup, just to get start and learn configurations with time. rPi 3 that I had already, ordered a Conbee II USB stick and bought some bulbs, sockets and remote on Ikea.

Got the latest 64-bit OS installed on a SansDisk A1 card I had laying around and setup went all fine with 'zha' without issues. But every night I would lose access to Home Assistant. Cannot connect via the Android app, or via homeassistant.local:8123 or via 192.168.2.99:8123, cannot ping from my laptop terminal and cannot see it in the router control panel. The only way to get it back was pulling the plug and turn on again.

Very important to note that Home Assistant and 'zha' was still working as I could click on the remote control all the controls for the lights and sockets were still operational. It is just the Ethernet access that was down.

I tried: a new power supply; a new SD-card; re-install with the 32-bit OS, revert back to 64-bit. Nothing worked.

After a while I noticed that it was consistently at night. I could boot-up the rPi in the early morning or just before sleep, in the morning it would be disconnected again.

Then I finally had the insight to remember that the router is rebooting:

**Tested:** HomeAssistant is working and I enter the router control panel and tapped the Reboot icon. The router reboots my internet and Chromecast and other rPi are all back online after a couple minutes, but the Home Assistant network is out.

**Workaround:** Disabled the router auto-reboot function and HomeAssistant have been working for few weeks without issues. It's a valid workaround but there's clearly some issue on HomeAssistant OS on the raspberryPi that does not affect the Raspberry Pi OS.

### What operating system image do you use?

rpi3-64 (Raspberry Pi 3 64-bit OS)

### What version of Home Assistant Operating System is installed?

7.6

### Did you upgrade the Operating System.

No

### Steps to reproduce the issue

1. Connect the HomeAssistant OS rPi to a router with software reboot functionality.
2. Enter the router control panel
3. Reboot the router


### Anything in the Supervisor logs that might be useful for us?

```txt
Cannot access the logs because network is down
```


### Anything in the Host logs that might be useful for us?

```txt
Cannot access the logs because network is down
```

title: Logs doesn't appear
body:
### Describe the issue you are experiencing

The logs doesn't appear. They disappear from the supervisor logs and form the addons logs. I had this issue on the stable version, I solve it, but when I upgraded to the development version the issue came again.

### What is the used version of the Supervisor?

supervisor-2022.04.dev3001

### What type of installation are you running?

Home Assistant Supervised

### Which operating system are you running on?

Other (e.g., Raspbian/Raspberry Pi OS/Fedora)

### What is the version of your installed operating system?

Raspbian GNU/Linux 11 (bullseye)

### What version of Home Assistant Core is installed?

core-2022.6.0.dev20220430

### Steps to reproduce the issue

1. Upgrade to the development version
2. No supervisor logs
3.
...


### Anything in the Supervisor logs that might be useful for us?

```txt
There are no logs in the supervisor logs or in the addon logs.

In the stable version I also had problems but I solved it adding to the configuration.yaml file this lines:

logger:

frontend:

system_log:

logbook:

They worked well but when I upgrade to the development version logs dissapear again even with that lines in the configuration.yaml
```


### Additional information

It is an unsupported installation. I suppose that if it worked in the stable version it could work in the development version.

 I didn't try to execute a reboot host so I don't know if the button is working or not but it's obvious there's something else going on with the screen.

title: Dotless hostnames for local network fail to resolve
body:
### Describe the issue you are experiencing

Supervised installations of home assistant cannot resolve bare dotless hostnames for the local network. 

This happens despite my router hosting a DNS server that can resolve the local hostnames, including specifying the correct DNS search path in the DHCP response.

This has been a long standing issue with the supervisor/OS, and it is probably worth fixing it. A full analysis of what is happening and possible ways to fix it can be found in the additional information section.

Obviously there are workarounds (like specifying the hosts fully qualified names) but it is still annoying.

### What is the used version of the Supervisor?

supervisor-2022.04

### What type of installation are you running?

Home Assistant OS

### Which operating system are you running on?

Home Assistant Operating System

### What is the version of your installed operating system?

7.6

### What version of Home Assistant Core is installed?

core-2022.4.5

### Steps to reproduce the issue

1. Attempt to use a dotless hostname for a system on your network (without making it a FQDN by appending a dot at the end), in home assistant proper or any plugin, when running on HA OS.
2. Notice that the host fails to resolve.

### Anything in the Supervisor logs that might be useful for us?

```txt
N/A
```


### Additional information

The home-assistant OS host environment (if accessed via debug ssh) actually can resolve these names correctly. But the home-assistant container and add-on containers cannot.

Why can't they? Well supervisor makes docker run them with customized DNS settings that specify the DNS plugin as the DNS server and "local.hass.io" as the dns search path. Since DNS only supports lookup of fully qualified names, glibc, musl, and friends will only try to resolve bare hostnames using the search path, so `myhost` is only passed to the dns plugin as `myhost.local.hass.io`. 

The DNS plugin is configured to resolve `.local.hass.io.` names from a set of mappings supplied by the supervisor, which only include the docker containers. It is also configured to resolve `.local.` mdns queries by forwarding them to the host's systemd-resolved.

For all other queries, the net effect of supervisor code and the DNSplugin code is that it forwards them to whatever the host's NetworkManager had written out in /etc/resolv.conf at the time that the DNS plugin container was started.

While home-assistant/plugin-dns#73 claims to make LLMNR resolution work, it only works if coredns were to receive a single label name. And the only way that is going to happen is if I specify the name as fully qualified in commands via appending a trailing dot (e.g. `ping myhost.` instead of `ping myhost`).  Which nobody does, and has downsides like such queries potentially 
leaking out to public dns, where they become root zone lookups. However, the appending a dot not only fixes LLMNR, but makes any other local hostname work, since the host's systemd-resolved handles them correctly.

Now there are at least three ways that I can see to fix this, although all will require fixing a bug in the DNS plugin to work.

1. Append the search prefixes from the host's resolv.conf to the `local.hass.io` suffix passed to docker. This works, but does have limitations, and would not make LLMNR work.
2.  Change the search path given to docker to be `local.hass.io .`. Thus when calling `ping myhost`, if `myhost.local.hass.io` cannot be found `myhost.` is checked. This would cause the mdns plugin to pass any such dotless domains to the host's systemd-resolved service which will resolve them properly. This works fine, but does potentially run the risk of accidentally forwarding such hostnames to external dns. 
3. Create a new dns suffix like `external.hass.io`, which the dns plugin's mdns could process by stripping it off, and passing to the host resolved. Then the supervisor could be updated to include this as a second domain in the search suffix list. This is probably overengineered, and the second fix is probably better, but I though I would mention this one too. This could be configured to NXDomain inside core-dns after the mdns plugin to ensure no leakage to public dns servers.

Now I mentioned a bug in the dns plugin that would need to be fixed first. That bug is home-assistant/plugin-dns#85, which makes failed lookups for `.local.hass.io` subdomains return SERVFAIL, which at least for alpine containers, prevents the rest of the dns search path from being tried. Yet obviously it is critical that `local.hass.io` remain the first entry in the search path, as otherwise a local machine name could shadow one of the containers, which would really cause things to break.

I'm using HA in ubuntu 21.10 using docker version "20.10.10"
after updating to version core-2022.4.3 , I lost my connections to my private hosting containers such as Nextcloud, after digging about the issue I found that after using "ifconfig eth0" there is no IPV6 address for ethernet.


### What is the used version of the Supervisor?

supervisor-2022.04.0

### What type of installation are you running?

Home Assistant Supervised

### Which operating system are you running on?

Other (Ubuntu on Raspberry pi 4 8 Gb )

### What is the version of your installed operating system?

5.11

### What version of Home Assistant Core is installed?

core-2022.4.3

### Steps to reproduce the issue

I used this command in host `nmcli connection show `and showed this result:
`Supervisor eth0   626dd384-8b3d-3690-9511-192b2c79b3fd  ethernet  eth0`
then this command `cat /proc/sys/net/ipv6/conf/eth0/disable_ipv6`
the result was 1 which mean that the ipv6 is disabled.
to enable it I used this command
`nmcli connection modify "Supervisor eth0" ipv6.method "auto"
`
`nmcli connection up "Supervisor eth0"`
then the eth0 now have an IPV6 address 
and I can now access my self-hosting website.
after rebooting the server the issue appeared again and I repeated the above commands to enable it again.
also when this issue occurred, the HA terminal does not show the IPV6 address, when it is solved the IPV6 show in HA terminal. 

### Anything in the Supervisor logs that might be useful for us?

```txt
no log in supervisor related to this issue
```


### Additional information

_No response_

title: 'Legacy' add-ons don't support secrets substitution in configuration options
body:
### Describe the issue you are experiencing

I'm attempting to use a 3rd-party addon (https://github.com/fuatakgun/eufy_security_addon) which has the `"legacy": true` config option, ie the docker container is unaware of Home Assistant, relying only on environment vars for config.

The addon is configured with a username and password, and I'd like to use secret substitution to keep my secrets centralised, as I do with all my other credentials and addons. However, it seems that the environment vars that are set in the legacy container aren't aware of secret substitution. The instead are set to the literal '!secret abc' string instead.

### What is the used version of the Supervisor?

supervisor-2022.04.0

### What type of installation are you running?

Home Assistant Supervised

### Which operating system are you running on?

Debian

### What is the version of your installed operating system?

11

### What version of Home Assistant Core is installed?

core-2022.4.3

### Steps to reproduce the issue

1. In secrets.yaml, add secrets `eufy_username` and `eufy_password` containing my credentials.
2. Add https://github.com/fuatakgun/eufy_security_addon as an Add-on Store repository.
3. Install Eufy Security Add-on.
4. In the Add-on Options, set Username to `!secret eufy_username` and Password to `!secret eufy_password`.
5. Start add-on and observe it fail to authenticate.
6. In the container, the environment vars will be literally `USERNAME=!secret eufy_username` and `PASSWORD=!secret eufy_password` rather than the secret's values.
7. Not using secrets.yaml, and directly configuring the options will work correctly.


### Anything in the Supervisor logs that might be useful for us?

```txt
The logs do mention the secrets being resolved, but I'm assuming that's just for the API, which the legacy addon doesn't use.

22-04-14 16:17:04 INFO (SyncWorker_5) [supervisor.docker.addon] Starting Docker add-on bropat/eufy-security-ws with version 0.8.4
22-04-14 16:17:04 INFO (MainThread) [supervisor.homeassistant.secrets] Request secret eufy_username
22-04-14 16:17:04 INFO (MainThread) [supervisor.homeassistant.secrets] Request secret eufy_password
```


### Additional information

I've taken a look into Supervisor and the simplest fix I've come up with is to change [line 121 of docker/addon.py](https://github.com/home-assistant/supervisor/blob/8c528f7ec54148d9847016a6c71737373e6742a5/supervisor/docker/addon.py#L121) to:
`for key, value in self.addon.schema.validate(self.addon.options).items():`

Though not sure if that's going to be the most correct answer, or if this is on purpose for security etc.

title: Static routing broken after 2022.4.2 update
body:
### Describe the issue you are experiencing

Hi

Apologies in advance - I'm not entirely sure what is handling the networking portions of HAOS. I would gather it is the OS, but docker may have it's own network namespaces that I'm not seeing, or a separate routing table I can't see?

After the 2022.4.2 update - Static routes that I configured via nmcli, ceased to work.

I added them again, and it does not address the problem, and I'm completely stumped at this point.

~~Traffic initated from HAOS routes correctly, traffic initated from another system (say, my monitoring server, or the reverse proxy), results in HAOS default routing the traffic.  It appears like there is two routing tables?~~
_(Above is incorrect, Firewall (device on default route) is sending icmp redirects to HAOS VM. Other way doesn't work because it's seeing one half of the traffic and dropping it due firewall not seeing the initial session initation)_

I rebooted, and I found that, despite telling nmcli to make the routes permanent, they were not. 

HAOS is running inside a esxi VM.  

_ip_ gives me nothing when doing an _"ip r(oute)"_ 

Happy to provide further information, but my  go-to network tools are providing me with little - and what documentation I can find doesn't really describe what's going on under the hood with HAOS & docker

ova (for Virtual Machines)

5.10.108

No

title: Configurations lost after re-install
body:
### Describe the issue you are experiencing

Hi All,
I'll try to make my story as short as I could...
1. I was trying to upgrade a supervised HASSIO through the UI (it was 2022.01 or .02 don't remember), but I was constantly getting an error that the system is in unhealthy state. 
2. Then I tried to restart HASSIO via the UI and it didn't help
3. Then I was thinking to restart the docker containers ... but I couldn't find them anymore
4. I did an upgrade of my kernel and a bunch of packages that I've been procrastinating 
5. I did partial Supervised install (just downloaded the latest DEB package and installed it)
6. The containers came back ... but when I tried to access HASSIO UI ... I got the onboarding screen.
7. I Checked and I am still able to find some old files and backups in /usr/share/hassio/
8. Then I tried to do a full restore from the onboarding screen with a backup archive (unfortunately not having my last known good setup), but nothing happened and I still keep getting the onboarding screen
9. checked journalctl and I found a frequent error:
`
Apr 09 17:07:14 barcelona hassio-supervisor[32882]: 22-04-09 17:07:14 ERROR (MainThread) [supervisor.plugins.observer] Can't start observer plugin
Apr 09 17:07:14 barcelona hassio-supervisor[32882]: 22-04-09 17:07:14 ERROR (SyncWorker_3) [supervisor.docker] Can't start hassio_observer: 500 Server Error for http+docker://localhost/v1.41/containers/85b9d43988de>

`


So now I really have no clue how to restore everything. 

BTW this is the 3rd time containers disappear, unfortunately this time I forgot that a work-around is to re-install docker-ce instead :/

2022.03.5

title: Slow loading of "Add-ons, Backups & Supervisor (/hassio)" page when offline due to external queries
body:
### Describe the issue you are experiencing

I restarted my router, which means my dns (which is a separate computer) cannot fetch any new info. I tried to load the HA Configuration page "Add-ons, Backups & Supervisor" (which has the URL '.../hassio') and it got stuck while loading for a long time.

Afterwards my supervisor log was full of error messages because some DNS queries did not work:


### What is the used version of the Supervisor?

supervisor-2022.03.5

### What type of installation are you running?

Home Assistant OS

### Which operating system are you running on?

Home Assistant Operating System

### What is the version of your installed operating system?

7.6

### What version of Home Assistant Core is installed?

core-2022.4.0

### Steps to reproduce the issue

1. Disconnect from the internet by turning off the router
2. Try to load the page '.../hassio'
...

title: Multiple timeouts since Home Assistant 2022.4.0b1 onwards
body:
### Describe the issue you are experiencing

Since the testing of Home Assistant 2022.4.0b1, i sometimes get timeout messages from various super addons:
```
Timeout on /addons/core_deconz/info request
Timeout on /addons/a0d7b954_adguard/info request
```
and
`Can't read add-on info:`

I don't experience functional impact for those addons, but the errros are there, and they appeared since the beta. It was working fine on 2022.3.8

I am using a Raspberry Pi4 8gb, Docker version 20.10.6

I also notice that since this beta, the memory usage increased (see the htop printscreen below). I'm not sure what the memory usage was on 2022.3.8, but it was lower than this. It could be relevant based on the conversation here https://github.com/home-assistant/core/issues/63662 .
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/74881023/161382355-64d2d5d2-21ee-42f6-8767-533a2a0de31d.png)

After a cold reboot of my Raspberry Pi, the memory usage drops:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/74881023/161383136-c6179300-78ba-4053-85cb-7e61b2843ae6.png)


### What is the used version of the Supervisor?

supervisor-2022.03.5

### What type of installation are you running?

Home Assistant Supervised

### Which operating system are you running on?

Other (e.g., Raspbian/Raspberry Pi OS/Fedora)

### What is the version of your installed operating system?

Raspbian GNU/Linux 10 (buster)

### What version of Home Assistant Core is installed?

core-2022.4.0b3

### Steps to reproduce the issue

1. Install Home Assistant 2022.4.0b3
2. Check the logs after the initial restart of home assistant. The errors popup in ~25% of all restarts
3. The errors also appear after follow-up restarts, but not every time
4. The errors also appear sometime (hours) after a restart
In other words, i cannot exactly replicate when the error message will appear, but they will appear eventually.
...


### Anything in the Supervisor logs that might be useful for us?

```txt
I cannot replicate the errror message in the Supervisor log, after a full reboot of my raspberry pi the memory usage is going down and the error is not appearing (yet?). For now, this is what i see:
```

title: Unable to upgrade supervisor after switching to dev branch and back to stable
body:
### Describe the issue you are experiencing

I had to change my supervisor branch to the development branch in order to recover my home assistant installation due to a previous bug. I am now on supervisor-2022.03.dev1102 but switching to either the stable or beta channels never actually updates from supervisor-2022.03.dev1102.

### What is the used version of the Supervisor?

supervisor-2022.03.dev1102

### What type of installation are you running?

Home Assistant OS

### Which operating system are you running on?

Other (e.g., Raspbian/Raspberry Pi OS/Fedora)

### What is the version of your installed operating system?

7.5

### What version of Home Assistant Core is installed?

core-2022.3.7

### Steps to reproduce the issue

From stable:
1. ha supervisor options --channel dev
2. ha supervisor reload
3. ha core update

Let it update to dev.

From dev:
1. ha supervisor options --channel stable
2. ha supervisor reload
3. ha core update

Core will update but supervisor will stay on dev.
...


### Anything in the Supervisor logs that might be useful for us?

```txt
No, but running "ha supervisor update" just states I am on the latest supervisor-2022.03.dev1102.
```


### Additional information

_No response_

title: Restore partial backup doesn't restore config files
body:
### Describe the issue you are experiencing

Doing a backup you can select backing the Home Assistant configuration files:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30116095/159251092-a607c9fa-436e-4346-acde-eab72ab069e1.png)

Restoring partially a backup that contains the Home Assistant Configuration files doesn't show this option:

![photo_2022-03-21_12-28-28](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30116095/159252233-b6902010-8907-4662-973c-da2a5a04fb20.jpg)

So restore completes without HA configuration files :-(

This problem is not happening before supervisor-2022.03.x


### What is the used version of the Supervisor?

supervisor-2022.03.5

Home Assistant Supervised

### Which operating system are you running on?

Debian

### What is the version of your installed operating system?

Debian GNU/Linux 11 (bullseye)

core-2022.3.5

### Steps to reproduce the issue

1. Doing a full backup
2. Download this full backup
3. Restore this full backup as a partial backup (i don't wanna restore the UniFi addon in this computer, for example)


### Anything in the Supervisor logs that might be useful for us?

```txt
No, it doesn't
```

title: Incorrect password on snapshot restore fails quietly
body:
### Describe the issue you are experiencing

When restoring from a snapshot if the user inputs an incorrect password into the password box and clicks restore, the restore process begins and then spits out some opaque errors.

Ideally the UI would pop up an incorrect password error.

### What is the used version of the Supervisor?

supervisor-2022.03.3

### What type of installation are you running?

Home Assistant OS

### Which operating system are you running on?

Home Assistant Operating System

### What is the version of your installed operating system?

Home Assistant OS 7.4

### What version of Home Assistant Core is installed?

core-2022.3.3

title: Default Home Assistant OS installation doesn't get up and running without an internet connection
body:
### Describe the issue you are experiencing

Easy bug to be described and reproduced, at least.

The issue is simple: without internet the first setup cannot be completed.

A total offline setup (apart for downloading the VM image) would be really useful for the parts of the world where internet is not always available yet one would like to have their home automated and managed. Obviously everything has to rely only on LAN services and not cloud ones. I imagine a cabin in the woods with some gardening stuff that can be automated but without an internet connection.

Following a deeper description of the problem and which are the components affected.

Following the docs for a VM installation I downloaded the vmdk file since I'm running VMware. I am pretty sure this happens with Virtualbox or KVM as well so no big deal with the installation media. I setup the VM as instructed and spun up in a limited environment (three VMs, one is a router-firewall distribution as pfSense or OPNsense and the other is a client machine with a browser).

If the virtual NIC on the WAN side of the firewall is connected then the Home Assistant OS installation works and arrives to the "create new user page" as showed in the first part of the [onboarding guide](https://www.home-assistant.io/getting-started/onboarding/). No big deal here.

If the virtual NIC is disconnected the entire installation hangs and doesn't show the first part of the initial wizard which is expected since the wizard is contained inside the Docker image that cannot be pulled from the internet.

The logs available in the ha supervisor logs command of the VM console keep raising [this exception](https://github.com/home-assistant/supervisor/blob/d2dc78ae6aa592a0687f8421266996bb239a9163/supervisor/jobs/decorator.py#L159).

I wonder if it would be possible to ship the image available at the time of creation of the VM disk and letting that deal with the initial setup.

### What is the used version of the Supervisor?

NOT AVAILABLE

### What type of installation are you running?

Home Assistant OS

### Which operating system are you running on?

Home Assistant Operating System

### What is the version of your installed operating system?

7.4

### What version of Home Assistant Core is installed?

NOT AVAILABLE

### Steps to reproduce the issue

1. Create three VMs
- Firewall appliance like pfSense or OPNsense with two NICs
- Client VM to use the browser and test the configuration
- Home Assistant OS
2. Connect the firewall to the internet with the WAN NIC and to a LAN with the other
3. Connect the other two VMs to the LAN interface
4. Configure the firewall to NAT exactly as a home router would do
5. Power on the Home Assistant OS VM


### Anything in the Supervisor logs that might be useful for us?

```txt
Logs accessible from (ha supervisor logs) keep showing "[supervisor.jobs] 'Updater.fetch_data' blocked from execution, no supervisor internet connection".
```


### Additional information

![haos_no_internet](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/74600987/158054722-f43a013e-f6f9-4640-9d9a-9d2bf938a424.png)

title: wake_on_lan sent on wrong interface for multi interface system
body:
### Describe the issue you are experiencing

I have two interfaces in my system.  The main interface connects to the house network (eth0) and the second network (usb0) provides access to cellular backup.  Until the latest version the general configuration tab only showed the eth0 interface.  Now it also shows the usb0 interface, which is proper function.  I can select the eth0 interface for broadcast traffic.  For all the discovery stuff it appears that traffic is routed out eth0.  However wake_on_lan packets are sent to the the broadcast address 255.255.255.255 and are routed out usb0 and not the selected device eth0.

### What is the used version of the Supervisor?

supervisor-2022.03.3

### What type of installation are you running?

Home Assistant Supervised

### Which operating system are you running on?

Debian

### What is the version of your installed operating system?

debian 10

### What version of Home Assistant Core is installed?

core-2022.3.3

### Steps to reproduce the issue

1. create a system with two network interfaces.
2. From a system routing have interface 1 be the default route 
3. Set HA to use interface 2 for broadcast traffic via the general tab on settings
4. Enable wake_on_lan
5. Send a wake_on_lan packet
6. Use tcpdump to see that the packet is source to interface 1 address and sent out interface 1 
...


### Anything in the Supervisor logs that might be useful for us?

```txt
nothing
```


### Additional information

Details on my multi interface setup can be found [here](https://community.home-assistant.io/t/ha-base-security-system-with-cellular-backup-and-24-7-3rd-party-monitoring/384042)

title: Supervisor Reporting Unsupported Installation
body:
### Describe the issue you are experiencing

Hi there,

I don't know where to go to ask for help. 

I was trying to update Node-Red plugin today with latest version but wasn't successful. I then went through to check my system and noticed my Supervisor (under System) having a "Your Installation is Unhealthy"
Eventually restarting the Supervisor clears it, and I was able to update Node Red plugin.

I checked again later, and the error has returned.

I have no idea what is causing this issue as my Home Assistant has been running "Healthy" for a year now. I haven't installed any additional plugins, of software from HACS the last few weeks. 

The only thing I did is move to the recent Core release. I've updated to core-2022.3.3 around 3 days ago.

Can someone help me out? Or assist me in narrowing down what exactly is "Unhealthy" here. Clicking the error just brings me to a generic home assistant link telling me to reinstall my home assistant entirely - not helpful.

title: Backup's fail when the `homeassistant` folder isn't included
body:
### Describe the issue you are experiencing

I had an issue reported on my repo jcwillox/hass-auto-backup/issues/50, but on further inspection, there seems to be an issue with the supervisor itself. Backups not including the home assistant folder do not work at the moment, for example, this following service call fails.

### What is the used version of the Supervisor?

supervisor-2022.02.0

### What type of installation are you running?

Home Assistant Supervised

### Which operating system are you running on?

Home Assistant Operating System

### What is the version of your installed operating system?

7.4

### What version of Home Assistant Core is installed?

core-2022.3.0b6

### Steps to reproduce the issue

```yaml
service: hassio.backup_partial
data:
  addons:
    - a0d7b954_logviewer
```

### Anything in the Supervisor logs that might be useful for us?

```python
22-03-02 16:31:35 INFO (MainThread) [supervisor.backups.manager] Creating partial backup with slug 124a8104 completed
22-03-02 16:44:35 INFO (MainThread) [supervisor.backups.manager] Creating new partial backup with slug 7fda804f
22-03-02 16:44:35 INFO (MainThread) [supervisor.backups.manager] Backing up 7fda804f store Add-ons
22-03-02 16:44:35 INFO (MainThread) [supervisor.addons.addon] Building backup for add-on a0d7b954_logviewer
22-03-02 16:44:35 INFO (MainThread) [supervisor.addons.addon] Finish backup for addon a0d7b954_logviewer
22-03-02 16:44:35 INFO (MainThread) [supervisor.homeassistant.module] Backing up Home Assistant Core config folder
22-03-02 16:44:38 INFO (MainThread) [supervisor.homeassistant.module] Backup Home Assistant Core config folder done
22-03-02 16:44:38 ERROR (MainThread) [supervisor.backups.manager] Backup 7fda804f error
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/src/supervisor/supervisor/backups/manager.py", line 152, in _do_backup
    folder_list.remove(FOLDER_HOMEASSISTANT)
ValueError: list.remove(x): x not in list
```

### Additional information

The issue appears to be introduced with home-assistant/supervisor#3451, at https://github.com/home-assistant/supervisor/pull/3451/files#diff-a54541c5ae1f660ef56a2d0c240f5a5f0ff0bc2d1960a2be36eeb85ca460e0f0R152.

It seems like `homeassistant` is being set to true even when the homeassistant folder isn't supplied. If it is set to true and homeassistant wasn't listed in folders then it'll raise an error. Backups via the WebUI still work correctly.

title: awesomeversion.exceptions.AwesomeVersionCompareException: Not a valid AwesomeVersion object
body:
### Describe the issue you are experiencing

Hello,

After a power cut, my home assistant did not work at all, not web interface. 

After investigation I see that the supervisor docker is no more present.
I launch `hassos-supervisor` command and the docker image is pulled and the docker started.
Unfortunately the docker continuously fail to start, delete it self, retry ...

I manage to get the log and find this stack:
```
Traceback (most recent call last):

    return _run_code(code, main_globals, None,

awesomeversion.exceptions.AwesomeVersionCompareException: Not a valid AwesomeVersion object
```

I did not find issue related to this error nor any clue on google.
I decided to have a look into the code and find that the version value are read from the config.json file.

title: Add docker enviroment variable DISABLE_JEMALLOC to disable jemalloc
body:
### Describe the issue you are experiencing

Some host devices running docker have problms with jemalloc due to an unsupported system page size.

`starting version 3.2.10
[20:39:59] INFO: Update udev information
[cont-init.d] udev.sh: exited 0.
[cont-init.d] done.
[services.d] starting services
[services.d] done.
[20:39:59] INFO: Starting local supervisor watchdog...
<jemalloc>: Unsupported system page size
<jemalloc>: Unsupported system page size
<jemalloc>: Unsupported system page size
Fatal Python error: _PyRuntimeState_Init_impl: Can't initialize threads for interpreter
Python runtime state: unknown

[cont-finish.d] executing container finish scripts...
[cont-finish.d] done.
[s6-finish] waiting for services.
[s6-finish] sending all processes the TERM signal.
[s6-finish] sending all processes the KILL signal and exiting.`

This issue has allready been solved for the core docker image https://hub.docker.com/r/homeassistant/home-assistant by adding the docker enviroment variable `docker run ... -e "DISABLE_JEMALLOC=true" ...` as described at https://www.home-assistant.io/installation/linux#optimizations

But when running the image `homeassistant/armv7-hassio-supervisor:latest` this enviroment variable has no effect, yet.
Starting home-assistant/supervisor results in the output listed above, even with "DISABLE_JEMALLOC=true".

So please add this functionality to disable jemalloc on the supervisor image as well as you did for the core image.

### What is the used version of the Supervisor?

3.2.10

### What type of installation are you running?

Home Assistant Supervised

### Which operating system are you running on?

Other (e.g., Raspbian/Raspberry Pi OS/Fedora)

### What is the version of your installed operating system?

QNAP Firmware 5.0.0.1932 running ContainerStation 2.4.3.208

### What version of Home Assistant Core is installed?

failed before installing any core

### Steps to reproduce the issue

Enviroment:
Running docker image homeassistant/armv7-hassio-supervisor:latest (ID =  7d135c8fa3f0)
with QNAP Container station 2.4.3.208

loading the image  homeassistant/armv7-hassio-supervisor:latest 

Enviroment Variables:

DISABLE_JEMALLOC=true
TZ=Europe/Berlin



### Anything in the Supervisor logs that might be useful for us?

```txt
Container did not come up to a point where i could access any logs.
The issue is Known: Host systems Page size is 32K, which is not supported by jemalloc.
Workarround is known: disable jemalloc.
This is possible with home assistant core, bot not wuth the supervisor image, yet.
```


### Additional information

_No response_

title: `hdmi_cec`: "No adapters found"
body:
### Describe the issue you are experiencing

I have enabled the `hdmi_cec` integration in my configuration.yaml:

```
hdmi_cec:
```

It seems that the integration cannot find the CEC device though. There is [an older issue](https://github.com/home-assistant/supervisor/issues/143) where people state that this is due to the lack of compiled-in support for Raspberry Pi. When I run the `cec-client -i` command in my supervisor, "RPi" support also seems to be lacking:

```
bash-5.1# cec-client -i
libCEC version: 6.0.2, git revision: libcec-6.0.2, compiled on 2021-09-13 15:21:02 by root@b4a5b4dda180 on Linux 5.8.0-1040-azure (aarch64), features: P8_USB, DRM, P8_detect, Linux
```

### What is the used version of the Supervisor?

supervisor-2021.12.2

### What type of installation are you running?

Home Assistant OS

### Which operating system are you running on?

Home Assistant Operating System

### What is the version of your installed operating system?

7.1

### What version of Home Assistant Core is installed?

core-2021.12.10

### Steps to reproduce the issue

1. Attach an HDMI cable to a TV that supports CEC (mine is a Samsung)
2. Enable the `hdmi_cec` integration in `configuration.yaml` (`hdmi_cec:`)
3. Restart Home Assistant and observe the "No adapters found" log message
4. Run `cec-client -i` in the Supervisor and observe that "RPi" support is missing
5. Run `cec-client -i` in the Supervisor and observe the `Found devices: NONE` error message

```
libCEC version: 6.0.2, git revision: libcec-6.0.2, compiled on 2021-09-13 15:21:02 by root@b4a5b4dda180 on Linux 5.8.0-1040-azure (aarch64), features: P8_USB, DRM, P8_detect, Linux
```

title: Bug : supervisor does not detect `Image` tag in config.* when switching addons from local build to image build
body:
### Describe the issue you are experiencing

If an addon is already installed with a local-build strategy, it doesn't update correctly if the new version has an image-based strategy.

Example from the logs below : an addon named addon_updater is installed in v3.9, with a config.json that does not contain an image field. It is therefore locally built. When updating to the v5.0, with a config.json that contains an image field, it still builds locally the v5.0 and ignores the image tag. Starting the addon then fails, as the addon reads the image tag and does not find the downloaded image. 

### What is the used version of the Supervisor?

supervisor-2021.12.2

### What type of installation are you running?

Home Assistant OS

### Which operating system are you running on?

Home Assistant Operating System

### What is the version of your installed operating system?

7.1

### What version of Home Assistant Core is installed?

core-2021.12.10

### Steps to reproduce the issue

1. Install an addon without an image field (local build) 
2. Update the config.json in github to add the image field, and build images
3. Update repo, install the addon
4. Observe in the Supervisor log that the image is built and not downloaded 
5. Start the addon and observe in supervisor log the absence of downloaded image 

Positive control : 
1. Uninstall the above installed app
2. Reinstall from fresh the v5.0 : it correctly downloads the image and starts normally

title: Fix local Add-on restore on blank instance
body:
<!--
  You are amazing! Thanks for contributing to our project!
  Please, DO NOT DELETE ANY TEXT from this template! (unless instructed).
-->

## Proposed change

<!--
  Describe the big picture of your changes here to communicate to the
  maintainers why we should accept this pull request. If it fixes a bug
  or resolves a feature request, be sure to link to that issue in the
  additional information section.
-->
Make sure to not reference version attribute from the DockerAddon
instance since it is not yet populated in case this instance hadn't
installed that Add-on previously.

Use the higher level Images.load() API which returns a list of images
instead of loading with the lower level API and then search for the
image we just imported.

## Type of change

<!--
  What type of change does your PR introduce to Home Assistant?
  NOTE: Please, check only 1! box!

title: Restoring local Add-on on new instance fails
body:
### Describe the issue you are experiencing

Restoring a backup which contains a local Add-on on a new instance fails with `Can't import image ...`

### What is the used version of the Supervisor?

supervisor-2021.12.2

### What type of installation are you running?

Home Assistant Supervised

### Which operating system are you running on?

Debian

### What is the version of your installed operating system?

11 (bullseye)

### What version of Home Assistant Core is installed?

core-2022.2.0.dev20220110

### Steps to reproduce the issue

1. Install add-on which is build locally (e.g. Frigate https://github.com/blakeblackshear/frigate-hass-addons)
2. Take a full backup
3. Copy that backup to a new (genuine) instance
4. Restore full back


### Anything in the Supervisor logs that might be useful for us?

title: DNS Message Storm
body:
### Describe the issue you are experiencing

After updating to the latest version and rebooting the host machine, I see a storm of DNS messages to 1.1.1.1 and 1.0.0.1 at a rate of approximately 1,330 requests per minute. This persists for 10-12 minutes then stops.

During this time, a 'normal' number of DNS(53) requests are also sent to the locally assigned DNS server, the system is fully functional, but shows an approximate doubling of CPU usage during this period.

![Screenshot from 2022-01-08 15-01-53](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/59442445/148649166-dfc9acfc-0feb-46a0-8437-d4f4e78bfa78.png)


### What is the used version of the Supervisor?

supervisor-2021.12.2

### What type of installation are you running?

Home Assistant OS

### Which operating system are you running on?

Home Assistant Operating System

### What is the version of your installed operating system?

Home Assistant OS 7.1

### What version of Home Assistant Core is installed?

core-2021.12.8

### Steps to reproduce the issue

1) All port 853 DNS requests on the network are redirected to a local service. N.B. In previous versions, blocking 853 requests would result in a 'message storm', but redirecting these same requests would not.
2) Update and reboot the host

### Additional information

I understand that the coreDNS component used in HA is configured to use these Cloudflair DNS servers as a fallback, however when these servers are unreachable (Clearly, redirected DoT DNS requests will fail because of the certificate mismatch), it should not cause the flood of network traffic observed at startup, especially when the locally configured DNS services are functioning perfectly.

title: automation trigger not detected correctly
body:
### Describe the issue you are experiencing

When disabling (incl. stop actions) and enabling an automation, the trigger for this automation is ignored, if set to trigger upon state change for X-time. 



If this is the intended behaviour, please disregard this issue, however I feel it is not very intuitive as the setup and states all suggest that the trigger should be acknowledged.

### What is the used version of the Supervisor?

supervisor-2021.12.2

### What type of installation are you running?

Home Assistant OS

### Which operating system are you running on?

Home Assistant Operating System

### What is the version of your installed operating system?

6.3

### What version of Home Assistant Core is installed?

core-2021.11.5

### Steps to reproduce the issue

Example: 
<an automation is configured to trigger once EnableAutomationBool ==1 (**for 1 hour**) 
When [Bool]EnableAutomationBool changes from 0 to 1
if within the hour, my automation is disabled(incl. stop actions) and then re-enabled, the trigger will no longer react as the 1h is reached, contrary to my expectations. Thus, the automation remains untriggered despite it being enabled at the time of the trigger being satisfied. 

### Anything in the Supervisor logs that might be useful for us?

```txt
no?
```


### Additional information

I would like to disable&re-enable a certain automation, to stop the actions, from a separate automation. However, the trigger must be set as a delayed state change which in my recent case completely inhibit the re-enabled automation from triggering.

When running an old Supervisor version (e.g. 2021.03.6 which was part of OS release 5.13 and is preinstalled on a freshly bought ODROID-N2), updating the OS fails with "Unknown error, see supervisor". Logs show that the new version file format is the culprit:

title: Supervisor menu just disappeared after migrating to version Home Assistant 2021.12.3
body:
### Describe the issue you are experiencing

Supervisor menu was working fine but right after upgrading to Home Assistant 2021.12.3, it is no longer visible. I can however access the Supervisor if I use the direct link

### What is the used version of the Supervisor?

supervisor-2021.12.

### What type of installation are you running?

Home Assistant Supervised

### Which operating system are you running on?

Debian

### What is the version of your installed operating system?

11

### What version of Home Assistant Core is installed?

core-2021.12.3

### Steps to reproduce the issue

1. Upgrade to version core-2021.12.3
2. Supervisor menu is gone



### Anything in the Supervisor logs that might be useful for us?

```txt
Supervisor menu works if accessed directly using URL/hassio/system but it is not working smoothly at all.
```


### Additional information

_No response_

title: mfa totp config fails after upgrade to Home Assistant 2021.12.0 and Home Assistant 2021.12.1
body:
### Describe the issue you are experiencing

[140454192928896] The system cannot restart because the configuration is not valid: expected a dictionary @ data['auth_mfa_modules'][1]
06:53:52 – (ERROR) Home Assistant WebSocket API
The system cannot restart because the configuration is not valid: expected a dictionary @ data['auth_mfa_modules'][1]
06:53:52 – (ERROR) Home Assistant Supervisor

If i remove the entries from configuration.yaml, it works again.

### What is the used version of the Supervisor?

	supervisor-2021.12.2

### What type of installation are you running?

Home Assistant Supervised

### Which operating system are you running on?

Home Assistant Operating System

### What is the version of your installed operating system?

	Home Assistant OS 7.0

### What version of Home Assistant Core is installed?

	core-2021.12.1

### Steps to reproduce the issue

1. upgraded to latest version.
2. restart of server.
3.
...

title: Can't update Home Assistant 2021.12
body:
### Describe the issue you are experiencing

Since a few months ago, my Home Assistant updates were having a small issue when doing updates: after clicking to make backup before update, the system would complete the backup but wouldn't update. I had to come back later and click to update without backup, event though I had the latest backup made.

Since last version (2021.11) it now requires to do the backup and update at the same time, and now I can no longer update.

After doing the backup and coming back to the update screen, I get the following Supervisor error:

```
Logger: homeassistant.components.hassio
Source: components/hassio/websocket_api.py:109
Integration: Home Assistant Supervisor (documentation, issues)
First occurred: 01:08:46 (15 occurrences)
Last logged: 01:11:11

Failed to to call /backups/new/partial - Unknown error, see supervisor
```

And the update button is "disabled".

The supervisor logs shows:

`21-12-14 01:18:57 INFO (MainThread) [supervisor.jobs] 'BackupManager.do_backup_partial' blocked from execution, system is not running - CoreState.FREEZE`

supervisor-2021.12.1

6.6

core-2021.11.5

title: WARNING (MainThread) [supervisor.misc.tasks] Watchdog found a problem with PulseAudio plugin!
body:
### Describe the issue you are experiencing

Hi. 

My microSD card died of my instance, so I had to start fresh and restore from snaphot.
Also I made rpi4 use SSD not SD and went from x86 to x64 version. Restore went fine, but as of this https://github.com/home-assistant/operating-system/issues/1119  issue plaguing my instance 
latest HassOS I can use is 5.4  tried different HassOSes but after while they all freeze and I have to do Hard reboot of Rpi4.

So after 3 hours with HassOS 7.0 my instance died. So I took downgrade path 7.0 -> 6.6 -> 6.0 -> 5.13 -> 5.4

But now my supervisor logs get this error every minute


title: Ingress proxy unpacks assest and work slowly
body: ### Describe the issue you are experiencing Hello from zigbee2mqtt team! Recently many users started complaining that z2m frontend open slowly. https://github.com/zigbee2mqtt/hassio-zigbee2mqtt/issues/236 https://github.com/nurikk/zigbee2mqtt-frontend/issues/1124 After some debugging i can see that when frontend is loaded through ingress proxy, it's loaded very slowly: there are few symptoms: - Assets aren't gzip compressed - Missing caching headers - Sometimes response comes in form of headers from underlying backend as is, kind of http response parsing issue Here're some screenshots This how it looks if we request frontend directly, without ingress First load (no cache) After refresh ### What is the used version of the Supervisor? supervisor-2021.10.8 ### What type of installation are you running? Ubuntu 18.04.6 LTS ### What version of Home Assistant Core is installed? core-2021.11.5 ### Steps to reproduce the issue 1. Install zigbee2mqtt addon 2. Start it 3. title: supervisor.store.data regex is overly restrictive.
body:
### Describe the issue you are experiencing

The supervisor.store.data regex prevents the custom add-on's from using images from MANY sources due to the unexpected naming convention. This requires add-on's that can rely on existing images to be copied and re-uploaded solely to change the name. This might be acceptable for one-off items, but it will cause the creation of add-on's that fall significantly behind release builds, or someone to actively maintain an item to update file names.

The error is primarily from requiring "word./word/word". Many docker images can be referenced by a single word name. Images pushed to any other site may be referenced by site.com/name, not requiring two "/". 

I recommend removing the regex restriction on the image name field in the add-on config files. 


### What is the used version of the Supervisor?

supervisor-2021.10.8

### What type of installation are you running?

Home Assistant OS

### Which operating system are you running on?

Home Assistant Operating System

### What is the version of your installed operating system?

Home Assistant OS 6.6

### What version of Home Assistant Core is installed?

core-2021.11.5

### Steps to reproduce the issue

1. Build an add-on
2. In the config.json use any image name that does not match the regex ^([a-zA-Z\-\.:\d{}]+/)*?([\-\w{}]+)/([\-\w{}]+)$


### Anything in the Supervisor logs that might be useful for us?


6.6

core-2021.11.3

2. Followed the steps in the trouble shooting menu:
Result of `Home Assistant Observer
Supervisor:     Connected
Supported:     Unsupported
Healthy:     Unhealthy`
3. Was forced to pull the power connection out to effect a reboot.
4. No change following reboot.
...


### Anything in the Supervisor logs that might be useful for us?

```txt
Am unable to access the Supervisor log. The error reported is:
Failed to get supervisor logs, 502: Bad Gateway
```


### Additional information

_No response_

title: Unable to upgrade to Home Assistant Core v2021.11.1
body:
### Describe the issue you are experiencing

Unable to upgrade to the latest Home Assistant Core on Home Assistant Blue.

### What is the used version of the Supervisor?

supervisor-2021.10.8

### What type of installation are you running?

Home Assistant OS

### Which operating system are you running on?

Home Assistant Operating System

### What is the version of your installed operating system?

6.6

### What version of Home Assistant Core is installed?

core-2021.10.6

### Steps to reproduce the issue

1. Under "Update Pending" > Home Assistant Core > Click "Update"

The update starts, but doesn't finish, so far I've left it for 45 minutes, but the install doesn't complete.
I've tried restarting host and supervisor and trying again, but I see the same issue.

I was discussing this on the Core repository, but was suggested to move to here:
https://github.com/home-assistant/core/issues/59077


### Anything in the Supervisor logs that might be useful for us?

```txt
21-11-05 08:18:50 INFO (MainThread) [supervisor.host.manager] Host information reload completed

21-11-05 08:18:57 INFO (SyncWorker_3) [supervisor.docker.interface] Downloading docker image ghcr.io/home-assistant/odroid-n2-homeassistant with tag 2021.11.1.
21-11-05 08:48:01 INFO (MainThread) [supervisor.homeassistant.api] Updated Home Assistant API token
```


### Additional information

I was having a slightly different issue with not finding the image, but have since resolved this by restating the host.
More details here on the core repo issue, potentially relevant: https://github.com/home-assistant/core/issues/59077

title: First installation broken: no supervisor internet connection
body:
### Describe the issue you are experiencing

Due to microSD no longer booting I had to reinstall HasOs, but on first start it presents the following warning:

21-02-02 15:32:07 WARNING (MainThread) [supervisor.jobs] 'Updater.fetch_data' blocked from execution, no supervisor internet connection
21-02-02 15:32:07 WARNING (MainThread) [supervisor.homeassistant.core] Error on Home Assistant installation. Retry in 30sec

The microSD had already given me problems a few weeks ago, when I still had an ADSL line and an old modem, but I had no problems with the installation; now with an FTTH network and a FritzBox modem, the process fails

title: Debian 11.1 update breaks Supervisor
body:
### Describe the issue you are experiencing

After typical upgrade of Debian (11.0 to 11.1) Supervisor were not able to perform anything useful anymore.
It kept restarting itself and issue was with:
`Nov  2 16:18:12 bx NetworkManager[512]: <warn>  [1635866292.9493] keyfile: load: "/etc/NetworkManager/system-connections/default": failed to load connection: File permissions (100644) are insecure`

After changing those permissions to 'a+r' (all read) and pulling supervisor's image once again, system was able to start.
During debugging I also downgraded docker back to 20.10.10

### What is the used version of the Supervisor?

supervisor-2021.10.8

### What type of installation are you running?

Home Assistant Supervised

### Which operating system are you running on?

Debian

### What is the version of your installed operating system?

11.1

### What version of Home Assistant Core is installed?

core-2021.10.7

### Steps to reproduce the issue

1. Have running and healthy installation
2. apt-get update && apt-get upgrade
3. Reboot (or not, doesn't matter)



### Anything in the Supervisor logs that might be useful for us?

```txt
n/a
```


### Additional information

_No response_

title: Supervisor/Observer do not detect/restart unresponsive Core
body:
### Describe the issue you are experiencing

**Observed Behaviour:** HA core becomes unreachable over the network, but observer says system is healthy, supervisor does not restart the core
**Expected Behaviour:** A HA installation that does not correctly respond on its https port should be marked as failed by the observer, and restarted by the supervisor

A few days ago, my HA installation GUI became completely unreachable over the network. I could not connect locally using browser or android app, nor via the nabu casa cloud.

I connected to the observer and gotthis information:
Home Assistant observer
Supervisor:	Connected
Supported:	Supported
Healthy:	Healthy

I am running hass-os in a VM with 1.5 GB RAM assigned. System has been running smoothly for about a year before this issue. Connecting to the VM showed the following console message:

ha > Out of memory: killed process xxxxx (python3) total-vm:3322064KB

I was able to restart the core manually via the command line.

### What is the used version of the Supervisor?

supervisor-2021.10.8

### What type of installation are you running?

Home Assistant OS

### Which operating system are you running on?

Home Assistant Operating System

### What is the version of your installed operating system?

6.5

### What version of Home Assistant Core is installed?

core-2021.10.6

### Steps to reproduce the issue

I cannot reproduce the issue. It probably could be done by killing HA core processes manually and checking how the supervisor reacts, but I dont want to break my production environment.

### Anything in the Supervisor logs that might be useful for us?

```txt
I could not find any log entries that could be related/helpful
```


### Additional information

_No response_

title: Unable to restore from backup
body:
### Describe the issue you are experiencing

My Home-Assistant instance stopped working and was not able to boot, but luckily i had a backup i wanted to restore from.

I wrote a new image of HA to the SD card and let it boot. After a while, I was able to choose whether I wanted to create a user account or load it directly from a backup.
However, I get the error message that my backup file is not a ".tar" file.

![firefox 2021-11-01 jEyu42](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/31526808/139703117-3d853eac-c0fa-42bd-889f-6805a413a150.png)

But the file is a ".tar" file...

![firefox 2021-11-01 UHTW43](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/31526808/139703233-7cb58519-5caf-4e59-943b-ec9d818d74cc.png)

If I create an account and then drag the backup directly to the pi via samba, this appears in the list as normal and I also see the entire content.

![firefox 2021-11-01 HLG946](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/31526808/139703315-1bd36f51-73bd-47b8-a24f-e6a5f3453bfe.png)

If I then want to load from the backup, it takes a short time and I am back on the page where I can create the account and the supervisor shows the following errors in the logs:

![firefox 2021-11-01 JiWa45](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/31526808/139703383-d9f93ecd-7b17-4c85-b268-4020fc031051.png)

A bit frustrating when you rely on the backup function and then not being able to load from it although you haven't done anything except to take the file that the pi has created and tried to load it.^^

### What is the used version of the Supervisor?

supervisor-2021.10.8

### What type of installation are you running?

Home Assistant OS

### Which operating system are you running on?

Home Assistant Operating System

### What is the version of your installed operating system?

6.2

### What version of Home Assistant Core is installed?

core-2021.10.6

### Steps to reproduce the issue

1. Create backup
2. Flash new version of HA onto sd
3. Try to restore from backup^^

### Anything in the Supervisor logs that might be useful for us?

title: Presence detection - NETGEAR 2021.10.6 update
body:
### Describe the issue you are experiencing

With the migration in 2021.10.6 (I updated on 10/21/2021) for Netgear, there's now a problem with state changes for presence detection through a Netgear router that I can't find any answers on since it's now done through the UI. Sorry in advance if I missed this somewhere else.

When I disconnect a known device being tracked, it does register that fact with a state change. But that also feeds into a group. HA isn't picking up the group change in status at all with every device being "not_home" unless it's manually set. So individual person/device shows "not_home", group will still show "home".

For the individual device/associated person(s), it inconsistently reflects the change in Developer Tools with state, but then Node Red isn't seeing that for the individual or the group state change from HA. None of the sensors have changed and it's clearly tracking the devices. But there's a bug in there where it isn't translating across the board the way it did in the yaml configuration for it.

Thanks for any advice on how to fix this!

### What is the used version of the Supervisor?

2021.10.6

### What type of installation are you running?

Home Assistant OS

### Which operating system are you running on?

Home Assistant Operating System

### What is the version of your installed operating system?

6.5

### What version of Home Assistant Core is installed?

core-2021.10.6

### Steps to reproduce the issue

1. Hardware: Netgear AC6900; Software: HA OS as described above with the latest (2021.10.6) update migrating the Netgear integration to the UI from YAML; YAML configuration was removed after migration update
2. Netgear UI configuration is set to 180 seconds for the consider home time. Everything else migrated without a problem into the set up.
3. Using a cell phone for WIFI presence detection, watch for the status to change from "home" to "not_home" or the reverse in Developer Tools for state change. Same with the group side.
4. Similarly, Node-Red is not fully picking up the state change from the "person.name" sensor when the device tracker status is changed either from the presence detection native in HA or is manually changed since the migration as well. It was working without any problem prior to the UI migration.
5. Other than a couple of state change nodes in Node Red, 95% of everything works when that "person.name" or "group.name" state is set manually. It just isn't registering the state change when the device is disconnected from the router.

### Anything in the Supervisor logs that might be useful for us?

```txt
I've checked both the Config Log and Supervisor System Log. No errors are populating in either from this since the system doesn't register the lack of state change when a device is disconnected or reconnected to the system.
```


### Additional information

It just appears there's some kind of disconnect between the integration and processing the state change by HA. I'm sorry in advance that there isn't clearer documentation on it from this end; that's getting into a level of programming I'm not capable of at this point.

title: Backup and restore of add on with no data fails
body: ### Describe the issue you are experiencing If I backup an add on like ESP Home that commonly has no data, the backup file created contains the wrong file structure, and restoration from this backup fails. Eg: ``` 21-10-22 03:02:11 ERROR (MainThread) [supervisor.jobs] Unhandled exception: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: '/data/tmp/tmpclnxs8ta/data' Traceback (most recent call last): File "/usr/src/supervisor/supervisor/jobs/decorator.py", line 106, in wrapper return await self._method(*args, **kwargs) File "/usr/src/supervisor/supervisor/addons/__init__.py", line 360, in restore await addon.restore(tar_file) File "/usr/src/supervisor/supervisor/addons/addon.py", line 868, in restore await self.sys_run_in_executor(_restore_data) File "/usr/local/lib/python3.9/concurrent/futures/thread.py", line 52, in run result = self.fn(*self.args, **self.kwargs) File "/usr/src/supervisor/supervisor/addons/addon.py", line 862, in _restore_data shutil.copytree(Path(temp, "data"), self.path_data, symlinks=True) File "/usr/local/lib/python3.9/shutil.py", line 563, in copytree with os.scandir(src) as itr: FileNotFoundError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: '/data/tmp/tmpclnxs8ta/data' 21-10-22 03:02:11 WARNING (MainThread) [supervisor.backups.backup] Can't restore Add-on a0d7b954_esphome: 21-10-22 03:02:11 INFO (MainThread) [supervisor.backups.manager] Partial-Restore ae36c8ce done ``` If I look at a simple example backup tarball, it looks like this: ``` % tar -tf October_22_2021.tar ./ ./a0d7b954_esphome.tar.gz ./backup.json ``` And if I look at the inner .tar.gz, I see this: ``` % tar -tf October_22_2021/a0d7b954_esphome.tar.gz ./ ./addon.json ``` Instead of the expected data directory/structure, which should look something like this: ``` % tar -tf October_22_2021/a0d7b954_nut.tar.gz ./ ./addon.json data/ data/options.json ``` ### What is the used version of the Supervisor? supervisor-2021.10.0 ### What type of installation are you running? Home Assistant OS ### Which operating system are you running on? Home Assistant Operating System ### What is the version of your installed operating system? 6.5 ### What version of Home Assistant Core is installed? core-2021.10.6 ### Steps to reproduce the issue 1) Create a backup from an add on like ESP Home that isn't configured with any options 2) Try to restore that backup ### Anything in the Supervisor logs that might be useful for us? ```txt 21-10-22 03:02:11 ERROR (MainThread) [supervisor.jobs] Unhandled exception: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: '/data/tmp/tmpclnxs8ta/data' Traceback (most recent call last): File "/usr/src/supervisor/supervisor/jobs/decorator.py", line 106, in wrapper return await self._method(*args, **kwargs) File "/usr/src/supervisor/supervisor/addons/__init__.py", line 360, in restore await addon.restore(tar_file) File "/usr/src/supervisor/supervisor/addons/addon.py", line 868, in restore await self.sys_run_in_executor(_restore_data) File "/usr/local/lib/python3.9/concurrent/futures/thread.py", line 52, in run result = self.fn(*self.args, **self.kwargs) File "/usr/src/supervisor/supervisor/addons/addon.py", line 862, in _restore_data shutil.copytree(Path(temp, "data"), self.path_data, symlinks=True) File "/usr/local/lib/python3.9/shutil.py", line 563, in copytree with os.scandir(src) as itr: FileNotFoundError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: '/data/tmp/tmpclnxs8ta/data' 21-10-22 03:02:11 WARNING (MainThread) [supervisor.backups.backup] Can't restore Add-on a0d7b954_esphome: 21-10-22 03:02:11 INFO (MainThread) [supervisor.backups.manager] Partial-Restore ae36c8ce done ``` ### Additional information _No response_

title: 401: Unauthorized / No valid ingress session None
body:
### Describe the issue you are experiencing

I have the exact same issue described here: https://github.com/home-assistant/supervisor/issues/3021 But with Brave browser (chrome based). 

I am no longer able to display the Web UI of Add-Ons such as Node-Red, Frigate, Portainer,..
The issue only seems to occur when I use HTTP to my local IP, I dont see it when using HTTPS

Clicking "Open Web UI" results in this message:

`401: Unauthorized
`
Supervisor's log reports:

```
21-10-16 12:59:26 WARNING (MainThread) [supervisor.api.ingress] No valid ingress session None

21-10-16 13:00:36 WARNING (MainThread) [supervisor.api.ingress] No valid ingress session None
```

Disabling brave privacy shield makes no difference.

Im using nginx reverse proxy if that makes a difference.

Home Assistant OS
